name: Oppmyre camping
comments: Perfect. Nice place at the fjord surrounded by mountains. Clean, modern facilities. Very well equiped kitchen. The only thing I particulary did not like was the rule to take off your shoes before entering kitchen.

Nice and very clean campsite. The site itself isn't anything spectacular, although the view is wonderful. The facilities however are very good! Everything's clean. The showers are free, and there's a well equiped kitchen and tv room.
Best showers in whole Norway, well equipped kitchen, awesome view. Directly at the water.
Oppmyre Camping is a new Campground here on the Vesterålen. Beautiful view, VERY clean sanitaries, so no problem to take shoes off! Wifi is weak, but no problem for me. Top 5 on our trip!
Excellent servis rooms, washer, dryer,kitchen, playground, sea view.

name: Charles Lucey
comments: nydelig plass ☺ kunne tenke meg at det var servering for turistene ☺ det ville trukket opp omsetning☺

name: Andenes Camping
comments: As others have said, the campsite rewards you with stunning views of the beach and crystal clear waters. However, all the sea views are highly desired, and, if you find a good spot, don't be surprised if you come back later and you've been tightly sandwiched in by the other campers (especially the camper vans). Overall, the campsite has an impersonal youth hostel style feeling. This was also clear as my hiking tee-shirt was stolen when left to dry in the wash room overnight (literally 6 hours!). The facilities don't anywhere near cover the demand and you have to wait for everything: kitchen use, toilet, and showers. The recreation room/dining room again will be packed in the evening. This campsite is run by the same employees of the Andenes Whale Center, casting an impersonal detachment between the campsite management and the campers. This campsite would be a clear five with permanent management and double the facilities, but as it stands, it is barely acceptable, minus the convenient location and beautiful views.

Totally Inadequate Sanitary Facilities. This campsite is in a fantastic location, very popular so gets hugely crowded with campers in the summer. There are no alternative campsites nearby, so NO CHOICE!!! No limit to how many people stay, the Toilet and shower facilities are totally inadequate for the number of people staying. It is also appalling that the toilet door locks do not work properly, toilet flush is attached to a length of string!! It appears the owners are NOT Interested in giving a quality stay, only to maximise their own profits. In my opinion the facilities at this campsite are a huge embarrassment to Norway Travel and needs to be upgraded urgently!!! never stay at this site again!!!! I DO NOT Recommend this campsite in its present state.

When I was there, reception was closed and phonenumber was not working. In the evening somebody came by to collect fees. 
Kitchen and WiFi are free to use.
Great view from the campground. When full, the sanitaries are not sufficient (1 toilet, 2 showers for men, the same for women). Small kitchen and a big well-heated room.

We spent 4 nights at the campsite (paid on arrival so couldn't change the plan). The view  is great on a sunny day and it's location is convenient, only five minutes walk from the nearest supermarket, 4 minutes drive from more supermarkets, and 10 minutes drive from the safari center. There are kitchen, dining room, laundry, shower and free wifi. The place has a commercial feeling, female staff here are more helpful, at least according to our experience. However, the place is quite crowded, with far less facilities to support the size of the campsite and the number of guests (two toilets and two shower rooms for each of male and female side), and the price is not cheap (120 kr/tent person, 40 for extra person, 120 for extra tent, 30 for washing and 10 for 5-min shower). The management of the campsite is not ideal, there was shortage of toilet papers; on an "unlucky" day, you paid 10 kr but may ended in cold shower; the bins were usually full in the morning

name: Andøy Friluftssenter
comments: Great view. Great Food. Very friendly people. Not crowded. Not expensive. Our best camping Site so far.
A great place. If u just staying for food or if you are staying for the night. Small but nice menu.
Amazing place in remotest possible piece of land on earth.
A great gastronomic experience! The food was absolutely delicious! We drove an hour just to eat here. Will definitely come back!

Large camping centre with restaurant. The huts look nice and the restaurant is popular, but guests in tents and mobile homes seem to be low priority. The price for a tent with a family of four is almost 300 NOK.

name: Granite Tors Trailhead and Campground
comments: Beautiful 16 miles hiking trail with amazing views from top. Well maintened. Spent almost 9 hours there on weekend.

This was the perfect stop for us after swimming at the hot springs. It was a short 15 min drive in our RV from Chena Hot Springs Resort. The sites are large and well spaced with a large fire ring and picnic table. Be sure to bring bug spray as the mosquitos are monster!
Great 16 mile loop hike and beautiful trail head and picnic and camp grounds.

name: Parry Creek Farm Tourist Park
location: Parry Creek Rd, Wyndham WA 6740, Australia
comments: The staff are fantastic. The bird hide is amazing along with the sunsets.
Love it here

name: Banana Well Getaway
location: Cape Leveque Road, Broome, Dampier Peninsula WA 6725, Australia
comments: Great spot with friendly staff, good access to tidal river to put the boat in and go fishing old school Aussie not the over commercialised places that were on offer elsewhere charging you for everything and anything they can.
Great staff and management.  Lovely, peaceful place of nature. Have stayed here several times before and will be back whenever we can.

Staff are friendly. Sundowner each night. Beautiful shaded camp with lots of wildlife and lilly pond. Close to tidal estuary for fishing and crabbing. We stayed a week and used it as our based to explore the peninsula
nice peaceful place to stay basic accommodation  was pleasantly surprised that i was about to get mobile reception (telstra)

name: Garnamarr Campground
comments: Friendly manager, well maintained, fair price.
Good camping ground, water, toilet and showers, no power. 30 AUD per night.

name: Céu Condor-Águia - Santo Daime Colombia
location: Calle 59, Vda. Piedra Gorda, Santa Elena, Medellín, Antioquia, Colombia
comments: This is a place to learn exactly what it means to be strong and diligent in your spiritual work. Inca is very nice and a master teacher. I will definitely come back in the future❤️🌈✌🏼😜
Best work ever. Thank you Inca, thanks to all church members, thank you Daime!

It was a wonderful experience staying at Inca's place. Not only that Inca is an uncomplicated an caring person who speaks Spanish, English, Italian, and Brasilian Portuguese. The place itself in beautiful nature brings peace to any (traveller-) soul.

Inca and all the people we met through her were very warm hearted human beings who made our stay even more lovely.

If you are interested you can join the healing works that are held on a regular basis. Inca leads them in a serious, thus save way.

You can pitch your own tent under a nicely prepared shelter or use one of the already installed tents. Alternatively you can stay in the dormitory - in a very nice wooden house with a balcony and fantastic view.
There is a covered outdoor kitchen to use, warm outdoor shower and wifi. It is nice if you bring some food for yourself as well as to share with others. There are also two small shops nearby.

As animal lovers we were very happy to see that the chicken and dogs were treated well and most of the time could run freely and joyfully all over the place.

Thank you again Inca and everyone, we will never forget these amazing 11 days!

***************************************

Es war eine wundervolle Erfahrung bei Inca. Sie ist nicht nur unkompliziert und fürsorglich, Inca spricht auch Spanisch, Englisch, Italienisch und brasilianisches Portugiesisch. Zudem schenkt der Ort, inmitten schönster Natur gelegen, jeder (Reise-) Seele Frieden.

Inca und alle Leute, welche wir durch sie kennengelernt haben, waren sehr herzlich, was unseren Aufenthalt noch mehr bereichert hat.

Falls Du interessiert bist, kannst Du an den Heilungs-Arbeiten teilnehmen, welche regelmässig durchgeführt werden. Inca leitet diese in seriöser und sicherer Weise.

Du kannst Dein eigenes Zelt unter einem Unterstand aufbauen oder ein bereits aufgestelltes Zelt benutzen. Alternativ kannst Du auch im gemeinsam benutzten Haus übernachten - es ist aus Holz und hat einen Balkon mit fantastischem Ausblick.
Es gibt eine überdachte Freiluftküche zur Mitbenutzung, eine warme Freiluftdusche und wifi. Es ist schön wenn Du eigenes Essen mitbringst und auch teilst. Es gibt zwei kleine Läden in der Nähe.

Als Tierfreunde waren wir glücklich zu sehen dass die Hühner und Hunde gut behandelt wurden und meistens frei und fröhlich überall herumrennen konnten.

Danke nochmals Inca und allen, wir werden die unglaublichen 11 Tage bei Dir nie vergessen!

Este lugar, en el medio del bosque y su magia, no es un espacio para estar de paso, más bien es un sitio que se convierte en tu hogar si te das la posibilidad de comprometerte con la medicina que allí te espera. 
Como parte de mi viaje por Colombia, pensaba pasar allí 4 días, pero se convirtieron en 25. En verdad que estaré siempre agradecida por todo lo que recibí en este lugar. Sanación, encuentros, amigxs, alimento, paz, aprendizajes, entendimiento y tantas cosas imposibles de narrar de narrar en unas lineas. 
Muchas gracias de corazón a Inca, que con tanto amo comparte la medicina del Santo Daime.

name: Flamingos Camping Entertainment
comments: Great location. Toilet blocks not good. If you are prepared to use your own facilities and don't mind the cows and chickens on the campsite its fine!
Great Campsite
Cooul
Good
Awesome camping!

name: Thermal Alejandria
location: Alejandría-Santo Domingo, Santo Domingo, Concepción, Antioquia, Colombia
comments: Muy pequeño el sitio pero muy acogedor...

Es cercano a Alejandría, y cuenta con 3 piscinas de diferentes tamaños. Es un termal diferente. El agua no huele a azufre y no es tan caliente. El servicio es muy bueno. Cuentan con servicio de restaurante y con hamacas para siesta.
Buen servicio, el agua no estan caliente, y deben mejorar la variedad de licores en la tienda

name: Torre Mucchia
comments: Indicato per una vacanza all'insegna della tranquillità e in famiglia.

name: The Clover La Romanera
location: El Valle, al final del sector las cuadras., El Valle, Mérida, Venezuela
comments: Amazing

Excelente atencion, extraodinario menu y exquisita comida hacen de este lugar uno de mis preferidos, Para los niños y lo que no lo son tienen una extraodinaria cancha de paintball de las mas emocionantes y su vista al paramo hacen de este lugar de los mejores para pasar un dia en merida se los recomiendo.
Porque tienen variedad, buen servicio y muchos lugares al aire libre y ofrece unas de las mejores canchas de painball de VZLA
Lindo lugar con un clima muy agradable y una atención muy personalizada. La comida muy rica y variada. Buena opción para probar algo distinto

name: Grupo Scout Titanes 198
comments: Perteneci al grupo años atras, convidaria a muchos a unirsen al grupo.
Tengo acuerdos para dia esprrar tuyo te amor si pueden dia ok juntos dos somos ya
Solo compartí con ellos una sola ves y fue increíble
Estos es hermoso

name: Camping Eucalyptus
location: Via Abruzzo, 69, 64011 Alba Adriatica TE, Italy
comments:
Ho avuto modo di soggiornare in un trilocale, i quali sono minimali, spartani, ma comodi. Il vero difetto può essere la privacy, la quale è a livelli veramente bassi, in quanto essendo le casette molto strette, la gente che passa per le stradine fuori ha libera vista dell'interno della casa. Manca inoltre un giardino/terrazzo/veranda per mangiare fuori, o meglio c'è, ma sempre di fronte a quelli delle abitazioni attorno.
Presente bella piscina, piscina bassa e piscina con getti idromassaggio.
Presente anche piccolo parco giochi all'aperto per i piccoli, un posto dove mangiare bene a prezzi economici e un piccolo palco per l'animazione (la quale la sera prosegue sino a mezzanotte, nel caso abbiate la casa vicino e vogliate dormire prima sarà difficile).
A poche centinaia di metri è presente la spiaggia con ombrelloni dedicata al camping e per ogni trilocale sono date in dotazione due bici ben tenute.
Non sono solito frequentare camping, per cui forse non riesco ad essere abbastanza oggettivo, ma ho avuto un impressione tutt'altro che negativa di questo.

Ottimo per famiglie, da provare anche qualche giorno sia per il servizio molto pulito che curato con personale cordiale e disponibile. La piscina grande e molto bella con parte idromassaggio molto curata. Prezzi buoni accessibili a tutti. Si accettano animali. Lo consiglio....

Ambiente familiare e accogliente !!! Ideale per passare il tempo libero sia in tenda sia in comode casette con aria condizionata , utile per chi ha bimbi piccoli , e per i piu' grandi la piscina e' ideale x il relax !!!! Bravi gli animatori che col sorriso riescono a scaldare il camping

È la quarta volta che passiamo la vacanza qui in bungalow, abbiamo provato i 2 e i 3 locali, perfetti entrambi, puliti e con tutto ciò che serve animazione valida e non insistente,  la spiaggia dista circa 400 mt ma comprese nel prezzo danno 2 bici, ombrellone sdraio e lettino,  la piscina è una delle più pulite e bene organizzate che ho trovato. Penso proprio che ci torneremo
Bella scoperta! Bravi! Un plauso alla mitica animazione! Molto bella anche la piscina. Personale sempre disponibile, molto soddisfatto bella vacanza.

name: Zona para Acampar
comments: Un sitio entre dos montañas muy altas el acceso es para vehículos doble tracción, se puede acampar solo de día excelente para estar en contacto con la naturaleza.
es bello para disfrutar 2 1 dia
Un lugar muy bonito. Ideal para acampar. Seguro y tranquilo. Mucha fauna y flora.
Es un excelente sitio para acampar, un clima bastante fresco, hay acceso a agua, libre de ruidos y molestias.
Excelente

name: Camping Village Calypso
location: Via Boccabianca, 7, 63064 Cupra Marittima AP, Italy
comments: Ok
Very nice campsite and perfect beach. Food is very good and the service is outstanding. Perfect for small children.

best camping feeling ever! we are from germany and drive every year to camping calypso. Camp, trailer, mobile home or bungalow that doesnt matter. every year we discover new and surprising things. thanks for all in the last 20 years !!!
Good

Chi è privo di sensibilità interiore non vede le piccole cose. In questo campeggio mi sono sentito PROTETTO. In due giorni ho scaricato la tensione di un anno devastante per me e mia moglie. È stato emozionante ricevere particolari attenzioni da parte di persone eccezionali. Non lo dico per fare pubblicità. Ma dico esattamente quello che ho provato. Di questo vi ringrazio.

name: Riva Nuova camping village
location: Via dei Pioppi, 6, 64014 Martinsicuro TE, Italy
comments: Great camping with all the comfort you need, swimming pool and beach, good entertainment from an animation team. We had a great time
Staff speaks English. Facilities clean. Have been there end of may - not yet crowded and calm in the evening. Price value is fine
The camping it self is great. Only the town and Boulevard around it is still a little quiet.
Perfect
Bel camping

name: Villaggio La Mandragola
location: Via dei Pini, 08029 Siniscola NU, Italy
comments: Great access to the sea, surrounded by pine trees. Very nice place just a bit expensive (2 humans + car are priced separately + electricity = €27 a night)
Nice and silent camping site with many pine trees (good for some shadow and for the hammock!) and direct access to the beach. Very friendly staff. Nice little Bar and Restaurant.

Scarsina la cordialità all'accoglienza. Non ci hanno detto che non c'era camper service e il mattino successivo ci hanno rinfacciato che c'era un cartello all'ingresso che lo diceva. n.b. il cartello era un foglio A4 scritto a mano e attaccato. Almeno ci hanno fatto un piccolo sconto x l'accaduto. Santa Lucia é carina e dormire in pineta é sempre piacevole comunque. il consiglio: andate nel camping a fianco!! molto meglio.

Sehr schöner weitläufiger Campground mit eigenem Strandzugang. Toiletten und Duschen sind in gutem Zustand. Genug Platz unter den Pinien um Hängematten aufzuhängen. Freie Platzwahl beim Zelten. Die Bucht ist traumhaft schön mit sehr seichten Wasser. Wir kommen hier bestimmt wieder her.
Campeggio molto accogliente, sul mare, con tutti i servizi necessari presenti e forniti (market, bar, ristorante). Personale gentilissimo. Bello!

name: Camping Cala D'Ambra
location: Via Ogliastra, 12, 08020 San Teodoro OT, Italy
comments: The place is small and cosy, with nice rocky and sandy beach directly accessible. Shadow all the time in many camp sites. Toilets are simple but clean. Also wifi was working very well. One last: 10 minutes walk from downtown. One remark: week-end loud music at the camp restaurant is very annoying, and lasts after midnight...
Ok

Campeggio tranquillo accogliente posizione ottima si può arrivare in centro anche a piedi.
Il proprietario è tutto lo staff gentilissimi e disponibili..abbiamo alloggiato in una delle case mobili e ci siamo trovati benissimo..anche il ristorante è molto comodo e offre un ottimo servizio..e buona cucina..
Anche se la spiaggia non è grande..si sta benissimo perché è tranquilla e la posizione è ottimale ..per la vicinanza ad altre belle spiaggie ..e comunque il campeggio ha un bus navetta per le  spiaggie più lontane.
Campeggio ideale per chi ha animali che sono ammessi ...da migliorare la linea Internet che nella zona ha poca copertura!!!
Unico consiglio per chi ama le serate tranquille meglio affittare i bungalow in muratura e/o le case mobili e le piazzole vicino all'entrata ..perché la sera verso la spiaggia si sente la musica del villaggio vicino..che però abbiamo notato che terminava attorno a mezzanotte!!! Bellissima luoghi e vacanza !!!

Camping bellissimo, in riva al mare.
Pulito in ordine  e con navetta puntuale e confortevole  ( una stella in più  a NINO, per la gentilezza e la disponibilità ).
Docce calde gratis e acqua calda nei lavabo(non è da tutti!!!) Market ristorante e pizzeria.. VICINO AL CENTRO DI  SAN TEODORO. .
Lo consiglierei ad occhi chiusi. ..

campeggio semplice bagni un po' piccoli ma super puliti ben ombreggiato propietari disponibili.
Direttamente sul mare la spiaggia un po' piccolina ma con la navetta si arriva alle spiagge più belle della zona.
cinque stelle con la promessa che migliori la vigilanza notturna nel rispetto del riposo, non è consueto ma quando capita andrebbe gestito meglio.

name: EurCamping Abruzzo Italy
location: Lungomare Trieste, 90, 64026 Roseto degli Abruzzi TE, Italy
comments: Very good place to spend your holiday, nice sports and recreational facilities
Ok!!

Le due stelle sono date per via di una signora alla direzione (probabilmente la proprietaria) ...ritengo che qualsiasi divergenza deve essere affrontata con garbo !!! dato che il cliente è quello che paga (e come si dice ha sempre ragione) .... e a dire il vero l'ingresso in questo camping È VERAMENTE COSTOSO !!! 
Per altro struttura grande ben tenuta e organizzata

Sehr freundliches, hilfsbereites Personal
Saubere, gepflegte Sanitäreinrichtung. Im Oktober natürlich nur noch 1 Waschhaus geöffnet.
Üblicher Standard, Toiletten ohne Brille und Papier, aber sauber. Der Steinige Strand nicht unbedingt.
Badetemperatur absolut in Ordnung für Oktober.
Ein sehr angenehmer Aufenthalt bei top Wetter👍

Campeggio ricco di servizi, staff professionale e cordiale, bellissimo in tutte le sue strutture e fornito di spiaggia, piscina e impianti sportivi di ottimo livello. Un'oasi di tranquillità per famiglie e ragazzi. Consigliatissimo.

name: Three Sisters Campground
location: 2 Ave, Bighorn No. 8, AB T0L, Canada
comments: Many sites on the Bow river & on a creek. First come first serve camping available. Had some friendly wildlife encounters. Mosquito population was high. Very scenic, there is vehicle noise from nearby highway.

This weekend (July Long) was our first time staying here, it was a last minute decision, and we were lucky they even had a spot available...  I thought it was a cute little campsite! I love that it sits along the river and can’t wait to camp there again and spend the day floating down. It is really close to the highway, so of course it’s a bit loud but I didn’t find it unbearable. The only 2 things that I didn’t like was the bathrooms, they stunk so bad… I guess that comes along with outhouses, but damn it was bad. And the mosquitoes were horrible! Couldn’t sit still for a minute without swatting away mosquitoes… but that could have just been this time. 
I’ll definitely visit again. If it’s on your way and you need somewhere to stay, I think it’s just fine!

Convenient location close to Banff and Calgary. Close convenience store. Awesome scenic location next to the river and relatively spacious camping spaces. Only down sides were thick mosquitoes and smelly toilets but worth it for the camping.

I went tenting here in a group of four with two tents and had to pay $26 a night PER TENT. It was a rip off considering there was no services besides a shared out house and water pump. If you are going in a group I suggest all sleeping in one big ten or trailer because you will save $26 a night. Also the person working at the campsite was not friendly at all.

Pretty basic provincial campground with only camping spots and toilets. No showers and or garbage bins (that I could find). It's near the highway, but the traffic is far enough away that it's not loud, unlike the camping sites in Canmore where the traffic is very close. Very few bugs when I was there last weekend.

name: Wapiti Campground
location: 100 Ray McBride St, Canmore, AB T1W 0B1, Canada
comments: It's fine but it's far from great. I was mostly just glad to get a spot. Sites are quite cramped, not very clean and it's very near the road but it is actually quite pretty. Showers cost $3 for {not-really-long-enough-to-shower} minutes! Bear boxes. No wifi. Staff quite friendly and near shops and the visitor centre.

Very nice place. Clean and comfortable.  Owners are super nice and very helpful. Has clean bathrooms /showers. Also has a laundromat.  Would definitely recommend this to all and would come back again.

Horrible Horrible Horrible. The Semi trucks, crotch rockets and regular Trans Canada Highway traffic are coming thru your campsite. It's the worst we've ever experienced in a campsite!
 The power outlet is at the front of the stall?.....you will need an extra cord to reach it, at least it was that way for our stall. The person working though, was great and got us a cord to reach the outlet. We tried to book elsewhere while we were there but of course, every place was booked on late notice. Don't stay in the North stalls, the road ways in front of the stalls are gravel, very dusty, no one slows down. The other road ways are paved!
Spend 25 dollars, and get what in return? Push sinks with semi warm water, pay extra for showers, and there's no visible dish sink. Go sleep on the side of the road, you'll pay less and get more
Easy access and quite except for the interstate.  That was ok though. Our neighbors all kept to themselves.

name: Whistler RV Park and Campgrounds
comments: After reading the reviews, I feel lucky that I had a fantastic experience at Whistler RV. I went tent camping with my husband, my 5 year-old girl and an 8 month-old boy. We also noted that we had a large tent when booking in addition to having child and infant. The campground placed us with a large pad, beautiful tall trees at the background, and pretty close to the bathroom.  Can't ask for a better site for our family.  Customer service, they responded to my email query about fire ban and propane fire pit within couple hours and were courteous.

It's a decent campground. The view is nice . It was very quiet. There are some full time trailers but you don't really notice them. It is 10 minutes from Town. We didn't talk to a single employee. Booked on line . There was a clip board out side the office with our site number on it, and no need to check in when leaving. The privacy between sites is zero, but they are kinda staggered so you get a little off set. We did not use the shower house's or washrooms .

Negatives:
There's more permanent residents there than campers. The Frisbee golf doesn't exist, all that's left are a few numbers on trees. The waste hook-ups are badly designed, who's idea was it to set them 1 foot above ground? Kinda defeats the point of hooking your RV up to them as you have to go out and empty the pipe making sure you don't splash poop on yourself. Speaking of poop, there was dog poop everywhere. 
Positives:
The view from the park is awesome. It's quite a big campground and it has full hook-ups.

Totally overpriced for an inexistant service ! The showers are cold, no privacy at all, it just looks like  a big parking lot, and this for more than 45$ ! And on the top of that, you have to pay 11$ extra per day if you want wifi, and there online reservation doesn't work ! The laundry facilities were all not working when we got there... 
Generally extremely disappointed ! 
So if you were planning to stay for the night, think about it again, and better check around what's still available.

Never stayed and never will even think about it again. I cancelled 8 days prior to arrival due to forest fires and the road in from our arrival destination was closed. They refused to refund me my money. I would have been better off cancelling the day prior. I would have gotten some sort of refund then. I was trying to be courteous so they could book out our site sooner...They are crooks as far as I'm concerned. I'm sure we were not the only people that cancelled and they were trying to save their profits for the season because of all the fires.

name: Entwistle RV Campground
location: 53230 Range Rd 74A, Rocky Rapids, AB T0E 1Z0, Canada
comments: Nice and close to where the floating for pembina river begins. The sites for the camping are nice and large.
Nice and quiet. And the nicest people.
Camp ground hosts were fabulous
Quiet, great group camping. Pembina River tubing just down the street and excellent quadding only 20 minutes away.
Group site was large, grounds were clean and looked after

name: Smokey Bear Campground
comments: The smokey bear is fantastic, I loved it from the moment I got here and will love the place forevermore. The owners Kathy and Clayton are extraordinary people, and amazing hosts. They go out of their way to make you feel at home and make you feel like your family, even their pets are extraordinary. Beautiful surroundings, and great atmosphere. Once you tasted the smokey bear there's no going back.

The staff here is super friendly! We got here late on Halloween and Clayton helped us check in without a hitch. Many campgrounds were closed for the season and I'm so glad we found this place with their hours posted online. The office had two adorable dogs and a cat ready for affection. The site itself was nice - full hookups for a very decent price. We didn't have the right type of plug and the office actually carried an adaptor and helped us out (it was free to borrow, but we ended up buying it in case of use in the future). The bathrooms were pristine and the showers so warm and steamy (and free!) - perfect for a cold autumn night. Clayton even gave us a few bulbs of fresh garlic from his friend's place, which we happily used to cook dinner :) Overall fantastic place to stay.

Pros:Friendly staff, nice bathroom and laundry facilities.  WiFi, water, power. 
Cons: You're going to be camping between the trans Canada highway, and a rail line.  Don't expect absolute serenity, but it's does die down overnight. 
 Previous comments have stated too, there's a high percentage of long-term residents.  

Overall good place, and good price.

Strange mix at this place. On the plus side the location is convenient, the bathrooms were clean with good water pressure, great internet connection. On the negative side... well, it was a bit creepy. Almost all the sites seem to be permanent residents, the residences near by are scary. Frankly, I would my let my kids wander around.  The host was very nice.
Highly recommend! A wonderful experience, beautiful cozy cabins, friendly atmosphere, kind accommodating helpful owners and staff.  We will definitely be back again on our next vacation.

name: Eiling Kramer Campground
comments: City campground that would likely be fairly busy during the summer months, was very quiet mid week in September. It is fairly open, but the views East are stunning! Get up for the sunrise and walk over to the east side to see it if you don't get a site nearby. Good prices for water and power and they even give you free firewood!!

Picture perfect, peaceful setting with sweeping vistas over the river valley.  Mature trees with unconventional ( non side by side) low density layout makes for a very relaxing setting.  The central showers and washrooms are new and very well maintained.  The playground emulates an old fort with turrets, towers, a small suspension bridge and real live teeter totters.  Great place for a getaway or a one night stopover.

Stayed here July 2017. Pleasantly surprised and happy with our stay. The park is easily accessed and the sites are large enough that you are not in close proximity to your neighbor. Hook ups and services were reached easily, and worked reliably. Quiet area with little traffic from the bordering neighborhood. Great walk down to Town of Battleford Flats and the Fort Battleford Historical Site is right next door. Short trip to shopping. A good place to stay and will stay here again. We stayed in a Motorhome.
Fabulous place for a stopover on our travels. Great showers and washroom.Very clean! Excellent friendly service. Highly recommend!

It's a city park. No vehicle entry to pay, just your camping fees! Quiet and right beside Fort Battleford. Showers and bathrooms in good condition. Some lots are drive thru and sooner back in. Workers were friendly and polite. Would consider going back for a weekend away.

name: Marsh Lake Campground
comments:
We have camped here a fair amount this summer, and I must say it is my favorite campground yet! 
The campground supervisor, went above and beyond on a long weekend, while doing his rounds, we asked about having the wood bins filled as they were all empty, he took it upon himself to fill the bins, and ensure all campers were comfortable! It is not part of his "job" to haul firewood, but he did, and at least 5 truck loads! So thank you Mr. Park Supervisor!
Beautiful campground.  The trash containers needed some attention but other than that we loved it.  Time permitting we would have stayed more days.

A well used, large Government campground. Lots of spots for all sizes of units. As per all government campgrounds the wood is free and the outhouses are cleaned regularly. There are NOT pump outs or fresh water intakes. This location is close to Whitehorse so locals tend to fill it quickly on weekends. Small rocky beach on March lake to walk on as well.
Nice campground right on the lake, big open sites, close to whitehorse
Awesome  place to camp

name: Wilcox Creek Campground
location: Improvement District No. 12, AB T0E, Canada
comments:
Impeccable facilities.

Associated trail offers an incredible view of both the glaciers and the pass itself.

Self-registration, firewood provided, no electricity, drinkable tap water. Not frequented by random tourists - peaceful campground.

A nice basic campground with good bathrooms. It's  close to the Icefields and hiking trails.

I stayed in July 2015 and scrambled up Mt. Nigel. We were able to walk right from the campsite, so that was great.
Very nice campground. Can slightly hear the highway if in power campsites.
Beautiful Jasper!
Very nice, remote, basic and close to Columbia icefield.

name: Coze River Lodge
location: Branch Mouth Road, Santa Familia Village, San Ignacio, Cayo District, Belize

name: Camp Persians South Dabaa
location: 29°53'40. 27°42'40.0"E، Sperpay Number 4 Rd, Qism Moursy Matrouh, Matrouh Governorate, Egypt
comments: مكان عمل مهم

name: Dining-Camping "an old friend"
location: Барнаул—Рубцовск—Семипалатинск, трасса А-322, Pospelikha, Altayskiy kray, Russia, 659700
comments: Повор не умеет готовить ! Бла там два раза и оба раза уезжала голодной. Обслуживают быстро. В зале порядок.
Дёшево и сердито. Персонал приветливый, пирожки с капустой и картошкой весьма вкусные. Туалет желает оставлять лучшего, но при таком потоке людей это не удивительно.
Борщ хороший, шашлык - не всегда! Салаты - лучше не берите. Персонал приветливый
Вкусно. Быстро. Рекомендую
Готовят хорошо, персонал приветливый. И с туалетами надеюсь, вопрос скоро решиться.

name: Parking for truckers
location: 25а, Нагорная ул., 25а, Kalachevo, Kemerovskaya oblast', Russia, 653212
comments: Ужасная стоянка , грязная!!!!!  А стоит как асфальтированная !
Отличный шашлык. Все довольны!

name: Lighthouse Hotel
location: Avtodoroga Baykal, Красноярск, Krasnoyarskiy kray, Russia, 663021
comments: Вкусно

name: Quatermain's 1920's Safari Camp
comments: Just a magical experience. The staff is beyond perfect, waiting on your every need. The expedition guides are different characters - the gruff, experienced bushman; the friendly naturalist; and the buoyant, jokester Xhosa native. Each one brings something different to the table, each one adds to your experience. They led us to hippos, giraffes, lions (with new cubs), and we say quietly while a herd of elephants enveloped us.

Truly one of a kind. This 1920s settler tented camp really takes you back in time. Set low in rolling valleys you have a true feeling of isolation, allowing the wonder of nature to take over. Wonderful boma dinners, set under the acacia Karoo, one the many trees found in this river valley thicket. Game drives are done on both Amakhala and Shamwari so you get a great feel for the biodiversity and terrain in the area. Highly recommend.

Spend our first night of honeymoon there. They surprised us with candles, chocolates and champagne in our tent. Food - awesome and the atmosphere very welcome feeling. The guides really went the extra mile to show us as much as possible

name: Sitrusoewer
comments: No flies or mosquitoes! Lovely grass camping sites, clean , big ablution rooms. Night light which switches off. Wonderful play area for children.
Spent a day here with family that was camping.  Neat ablution, lots of ground for kids to play on.  Nice braai and entertainment area
Peaceful and close to nature, but not much to do otherwise.
So clean and neat they keep improving on everything
Self catering comfortable chalets on the Sundays River- excellent fresh water fishing

name: Mvubu Campsite, Kabouga, Addo
comments:
Last weekend we camped for three nights at Mvubu Campsite in the Kabouga section of the Addo National Park near Kirkwood. Bookings should be made at the Addo Main Camp, but the entry point is near Kirkwood.

An excellent place to get away from it all - no cellphones, internet or TV - Just nature at its best.

There are 6 stands with a maximum of 4 people per stand. One hot water shower (paraffin-powered) and one flush toilet are available. Visitors must provide their own firewood. Water for washing is available but visitors should take their own drinking water. 

Obviously we had some visitors - an unsuspecting warthog came wandering into the campsite and monkeys came to have a look whether we forgot any food outside whenever we turned our backs.

The baboons were always there in the background but kept their distance. 

Lots of birdlife to keep us busy. We also saw Kudu, Red Hartebeest Mountain Reedbuck, Ostriches and my favorite, a Secretary Bird pair.

name: Van Stadens Resort (Buhlebendalo Properties)
location: Van Stadens Rd, Uitenhage Farms, Port Elizabeth, South Africa
comments: Was very nice at van Stadens. Beautiful beaches. Kids can play safely. No noise. I love the day out.
Great  camping venue, nice clean ablusion blocks, hot showers, marked camp sites and friendly staff.
Great facilities
Quiet,  out of the way,  miles of dunes and the ocean with a pleasant lagoon for swimming.  Such a tidy campsite and chalets.

Very beautiful setting. 
Bathrooms need some attention

name: Addo Main Camp
location: Addo Elephant National Park, R355 Paterson Road, Aberdeen, 6105, South Africa
comments: Very well organised. Plenty of wild animals to be seen: Elephant, lion, leopard,buffalo etc
Okay

name: The Homestead B&B, Self Catering & campsite
location: Homestead BnB, Valentine rd, Addo, 6105, Addo, 6105, South Africa
comments: nice and quiet campground. good location to explore addo national park (15 minutes to main gate)
Basic camsite. I bit expensive at R150. 11km from Addo entrance.
Close to Addo game reserve. Camp sites rather scuffy. Ok for an overnight stop. No comment on B&B as we camped.
Very well organized campsite with access to the fantastic features on the property. Hosts go out of their way to be accomodating to guest's needs. Great place

If youre looking for a beautiful place to stay for a night or two or three, this place is for you. Friendly service and delicious food make it feel like home. Located 5 mins from Addo park its the perfect base station and offers a tranquil setting with stunning gardens and a gorgeous lake. The lake features a wooden jetty on which you can sip sundowners after a long days game drive and is the pefect place to switch off and relax. Take my word for it, this place is truly a gem.

name: inniKloof
comments: Awesome and a beautiful place. Neat, clean and well kept.

A really awesome spot for camping or self catering if you want to chill. Alternatively, if you are a hiking fan then the Kloof Nek hike (guided) to the waterfall is a must. Only run once a month. 

Great for groups.
Great camping spot. Shaded camping grounds with ablution and fire pits. Swimming hold is close by and is equipped with tubes and a canoe.
Grt place
Lovely people and a beautiful green valley.

name: Big Fish Caravan and Camping
location: Gamtoos River Mouth Local Nature Reserve, Gamtoos Mouth, South Africa
comments: Awesome little hidden gem.
Good friendly people a clean place.
Awesome camping spot
Clean.. Friendly

name: Þingeyraroddi Camping Ground
comments: Small camground with 3 clean, heated toilets. Very simple, but enough for us. Acces to the beach/fjord, campsite has a dike and bushes around to protect from wind. Very nice and helpful lady, staying at the campsite gives acces to very nice swimming pool with hottub.

Nice camp but quite small.  Also area for tents is small (aprx.150 m2)so it can be disturbing when you wanna sleep and somebody in the next tent is speaking..i would expect mote for 1500 isk/person. What ia good that there are 2 swiming pools right next to the camp.
Pretty small campground, no kitchen and no showers. Has toilets though
Douches communes (piscine municipale) de 8h à 21h, pas de salle commune. Cuisine également accessible de 8h à 21h seulement. Peu de places... Belle vue comme partout en Islande ! Couverture réseau 4G
Camping tranquilo detrás de la piscina municipal. Dispone de tres wc y dos lavaderos abiertos todo el día. Las duchas están en el polideportivo abierto de 8.00 a 21.00

name: Tunguskogur
comments: Of our 17 nights in Iceland this was the one I liked most. The campsite is nestled into the fjords a bit farther away from the bustle of town. A nice house packs clean showers and toilets, and a tastefully decorated kitchen. There's also a guitar and an amp in the kitchen if you want to play some times while waiting for your food to cook!

The best campground we have stayed in in Iceland. The people who own this place really understand how to do a campground, unlike so many truly mediocre, filthy and undereqipped campgrounds that we visited so far in this overpriced country.   Spacious and modern kitchenette, trees planted as a windbreak in the camping area, and warm and clean showers.  This place is spotless.  Highly recommended.

Great camping site! Very scenic spot, modern and well kept facilities, friendly staff, just outside town. It is even possible to take a short forest hike, very unusual for Iceland. Definately recommended!

Yes! Yes! And yes! There is nothing to fault this campsite. Hot showers, nice clean toilet areas. Plugs for people to charge their phones, bbqs to use outside, a very basic kitchen area. Right next to a waterfall. Great job!
Tunguskogur Isafajador is fantastic. Easy walk into town yet no too far.  Quiet and nearby waterfall.

name: Proud Lake State Recreation Area
location: 2700 Glengary Rd, Commerce Charter Twp, MI 48390, USA
comments: A  campground with helpful staff! We camped during the Halloween trick or treat camp, it was so much fun for all ages! So many activities for the younger children and the decorations were great! Large sites with lots of room to unpack! Will be visiting again soon!

We hadn't been camping for years, but after a weekend here, we booked another site for two weeks later. The Modern Campground has 130 roomy sites, each with a picnic table, fire ring, and electronic hook-up (nice for fresh-ground coffee!) We had space for a six-person tent, dining fly and our car, but could easily have fit another tent. The centrally-located  bathrooms are nice and clean. :-) Canoe rental nearby, lots of trails, dog-friendly. It's much quieter during the week than on weekends, but aren't most campgrounds? Michigan DNR website has a map of campsites, including description and a picture, which is the perfect resource for helping you choose the perfect campsite for your next outdoor adventure.

Hands down one of my favorite places on Earth.  Hiking the lowlands, dropping a fishing boat or canoe in, all fantastic!   There is also a modernized campground, biking and horse trails.  Come for an hour or all day, it is a nice escape.

Beautiful location and beautiful price. I love to camp here whenever I can take time away from home. The way the campground sits is like you're really in the woods. And their bathrooms are the most impressively kept I've ever seen at a campground. Extremely clean and the hot water really lasts as long as you need.
Pure and pristine wilderness! Not a hint of a Civilization, even though it is near by. Paradise for experienced mountain bikers, hikers and rugged trail runners!

name: Brookfest Acres
comments: Stayed here during faster horses great location for a laid back weekend when at that event
It's a ton of people from every walk of life who for 1 week are equal.
So much fun!! Great camping and Faster Horses was a blast!
Had a blast at #fasterhorsesfestival
Great spot for faster horses

name: Crooked Lake Rustic Campground
comments: This is great place. Very quite and beautiful. Most campers do tent here not like crowded places with permanent trailer/RV. The staff are very friendly.
Quiet campground that makes you feel isolated yet is close to large city like Ann Arbor. Great dark skies for stars, hiking, and mountain biking.
This is by far my favorite place to camp In the Pinckney Waterloo area.

name: Camping St-Mathieu
location: 81 Chemin du Lac S, Saint-Mathieu-de-Rioux, QC G0L 3T0, Canada
comments: Très beau petit camping. Voisin du méga-gros KOA de St Mathieu de Rioux. Complet pour la location année après année. Je me trouve privilégier d'avoir un terrain sur ce camping
Camping très propre calme. Belle vue sur le lac St- Mathieu. Les proprio sont très sympa et chaleureux.
Depuis des années que jpasse par la chaque été pour le paysage sans vaut la peine
Dispendieux mais super bel endroit!
Très beau camping !! !

name: Riverwood Park Campgrounds
location: 31 Riverwood Park Rd, Lindsay, ON K9V 0K2, Canada
comments: This is a great campground with all of the amenities that you would expect and more.  The washroom/shower facilities are clean and well maintained.  Great location and friendly staff that were always helpful.

Love this place so much. Its a great place for all families. There is lots to do for both adults and children of all ages. We will be coming here every year for now on.d The ladies upfront our a delight to deal with and are always a great help.
Been camping here for 5 years now and love the park.  We'll maintained with tons of stuff for the kids to do. Adults as well.
nice spot! close enough to walk to town, nice beach, pool, camp sites and people.

Riverwood park is one of the best run parks that I've been into.There's something for everyone to do. I know lots of people in the park and never heard a compaiint, you never hear that. Love the park. Well done.

name: Camping Le Rayon De Soleil
location: 571 Rang Saint-Edouard O, Saint-Alexandre-de-Kamouraska, QC G0L 2G0, Canada
comments: Good location with nice Ted lots. Sites are a bit small and you can hear the road noise a bit but I got use to it fast.
Helpfull staff but camping site are very small.  To a point you dont want to stay longer then one night!   Did i say small camp sites
Camp  site OK , but washrooms, showers real dirty, checking staff polite.
camped every year so far...very nice staffs and very clean.
Sites were a little tight. The washroom and shower facilities are descent and clean.

name: El Colorado
location: México, Raquet Club, 83350 Municipio de Hermosillo, Son., Mexico
comments:
The place is pristine and beautiful.  However, there is no electricity, no stores etc.  Take items with you.  We met locals there that allowed us to use their showers.  There are only a handful of people that live there year round.  I would definitely go back, fishing on the beach and camping.
Oh and its recommended that you have a 4x4 or truck.  The roads there are treacherous.
Recomendada al 100.
Una playa con poca gente lo cual la hace más cómoda. Al subir el cerro tendrás una hermosa vista.
Hermoso colorado

Para llegar tendras que  .transitar por la calle 26 , saliendo por  la colonia El Palo Verde, de la Cd. De Hermosillo, caminar, hasta llegar a la calle 4 sur y de ahi a la izquierda , rumbo a Guaymas, son de Zhermosillo al Colorado unos 75 o 80 minutos

name: Sherrod Heights RV Park
location: 3717 Co Rd 26, Big Spring, TX 79720, USA

name: Horseshoe Bend RV Campground
comments:
We spent six nights at Horsehoe Bend Campground at Leavenworth, Indiana in our RV (no tent camping). We loved it--the campground's owner and employees are helpful and friendly, the only noise comes from the barges going down the river, and the sites are level with full hook-ups. We camped next to the river and sat in our lawn chairs just below our RV and watched the river flow. 
The campground is pet-friendly, has a boat dock, and also has a small laundry area (we didn't use it, so I can't comment on the building itself or how it worked).
The campground provides 70 RV sites and two cabins (I think two, perhaps one) for rent. Using our antenna, we were able to pick up two stations. 
I would happily go back tomorrow.
It was great! I was the only one there and the power and water was still on.

Very hard place to Find! Once we got there we had no phone service, no wi-fi, no television signal or even radio signal! The road leading to the campground is very narrow & scary if you meet another vehicle! The campground owners are pretty nice.

I made reservations by phone and paid in advance. From what we could see about this park on the google maps, it looked like it was located in a nice area. Due to lots of issues with traffic, we arrived at the park after dark. The GPS instructions to get us from the freeway to the park tried to take us on a one lane dirt road so I had to manually navigate the map for us to get to the park. The entrance road to the park is very hilly and only big enough for one large vehicle at a time. Since we arrived so late we did not encounter any traffic coming from the other direction, but it made us wonder what we would have done if there was. The campsites had been redone and so there were full hookups at the sites. There were no public bathrooms that we could see. The campsites were very close together. It is a pretty area, but given the difficulty in getting to it on such a narrow road, we will not be going back.
Love the cabin. Very peaceful

name: Louisville North Campground
comments:
The bathrooms and showers are always spotless and have a freshly cleaned smell.
We stayed there two night and yes on night one the trains were a bit distracting. I'm not sure if I got used to it or if there weren't as many on the second night.
The location is very good and the neighborhood is NOT crummy (as referenced in a prior review).
The spots are tight, very tight but the hook ups are all modern and convenient.
The people were very friendly.

I made a reservation online, received a confirmation email, and they did not have a spot for me.  They did not have record of my reservation in their system.  I presented the confirmation email and they agreed their system is not working properly; however, they were not willing to help me secure another location (the attendant simply walked away from me parked in my RV and went back into the office leaving me there to figure it out on my own).  The upshot to this experience for me was service recovery and customer satisfaction are not a priority for the staff at the Louisville North Campground.

I have stayed at this campground several times before and enjoy its physical location very much.  I would invite someone from leadership to contact me if you are interested in seizing this opportunity for service recovery.
Have stayed here two times and will be back this week. We travel with our lab Plato and very accommodating! Excellent!!

But the train!!!! We stayed one night while passing through. Staff is excellent, facility is well kept, location is very central. The train was literally a stones throw from our camper. The planes passed over constantly. Looong night!

We stayed at this campground for 4 nights and thought it was great! We selected this location because if it's proximity to downtown Louisville and the Kentucky Bourbon Trail. It was an ideal location! Yes, it is tight, as other reviewers have commented-but not uncomfortably so. There are not a lot of amenities for young families, such as swimming pool or elaborate playground. BUT, the campground is very well kept and staffed! In fact, the staff were all super friendly and helpful--and accessible! The office/convenience store is open from 7:00 AM until 10:00 or 10:30 PM! We felt very safe and secure! Yes, there's a train very close-but husband's snoring disturbed me more! Lol We would recommend this campground whole heartedly and plan to return next year!

name: Indian-Celina Recreation Area
location: 20230 St Croix Pl, Bristow, IN 47515, USA
comments: Probably my favorite campground in Indiana. The staff is consistently friendly and helpful. The camping loops, including the showers/restrooms, are clean and well-maintained. I always look forward to our next visit.

We enjoy being outside around the fire with our kids & dog but unfortunately there is tons of poison ivy everywhere so we couldn't enjoy it. The spaces are really small. The  park ranger was super nice & the bathrooms clean. Short distance to Holiday World as well. We cut this stay short & stayed 2 nights.

This place is great. Sites are not small at all and have a few double-site options. Staff was nice and helpful. Brand new bathroom and shower facility--all clean. Great option for affordable tent camping.
We came here with are truck camper.  Very nice place, clean & electricity!   We enjoyed our stay.
Nice trails!

name: Mickey's Family Campground
comments: Love this place 😍🍀😎

name: Louisville South KOA Holiday
comments: I've stayed at a few KOA campgrounds in various cabins or RV spots. This was the nicest, most well kept one I've seen. Our cabin was immaculate and it seemed no expense was spared in the construction. The outdoor furniture is made of Rex, virtually indestructible! They've really got it together here and we will gladly stay here again. My only suggestion for improvement would be to put markers on the road with the number of the cabin or site to make it easier to find in the dark upon arrival.

The only place to stay in greater Louisville.  The staff was extremely helpful.  We had full hook up with 50 AMP.  We stayed five nights as we had an event in Louisville.  Not close to downtown especially during rush hour.  Bathroom were clean and the campgrounds were kept nicely.  Many activities for kids should that be the case.  The place was a bit on the expensive side but being the only game in town it is supply and demand.  We have stayed here before and will likely return.

Been coming here since I was a kid, and it's still a great family place to visit. I wish they'd keep the catfish pond clean and stocked, but everything else here is fantastic. Kids and dogs love it here!

Had a small family reunion (4 out of 10 siblings) , we stayed over Labor Day weekend.  Our cabin was very nice and the staff was very helpful and welcoming.  Especially D and Jersey.   We met Jersey at check in and then D took very good care of us the whole wkend. Such a fun, warm person.  Thanks and we are planning a much larger reunion for summer 2018.
Our stay was awesome.  The campers at 200 were the best! They helped us set up camp on friday then take down on Sunday.  Our God is good.

name: Patoka Lake Campground
location: 3084 North Dillard Road, Birdseye, IN 47513, USA
comments: This is a very large Campground accommodating 500 sites. Mostly level with several trees and a great place to ride bikes. The only downside of this Campground being the size that it is there is only two dump stations
I love the clean park great camp sites beautiful lake and nice staff
Good size sites, bike trails, hiking trails, disc golf course, nice firepits with cooking grates, fishing spots, what else could u want?

ok, just to get the boat in the water. Doesn't compare to rend lake at all. Rend lake has beach areas for the boaters, campgrounds that go to the lake. They even have trash cans. The bike trails at patoka appear to be very nice, but Im not sure I want to camp here just for the bike trails. I don't think I will go there again. Most likely will go the heilman ferry at land between the lakes or rend lake, Illinois.  Sad they don't make this place better for everyone. The people who manage this place should visit other areas and see how much better these other campgrounds and lakes are !

I love the cleanliness of the entire park!! Lots of fun and memories being made. Would love if the beach (or what's left of it), be kept cleaner of the goose poop, seriously grosses me out, not enough beach to move around it.

name: Shadow Lake RV Park
comments: If you're looking for seclusion, this is your place! I give it 3 stars because I have seen better. The closest place to shop is an adventure to get too it .  The play ground is a stone's throw from the sewage treatment facility. The property seems to be in need of facelift. And a good landscaper! Lol!  Still nice and quiet.

Great little park. People are super friendly. Note that the park is small and gives a great outdoors camping feel. If the person who helped us 930 at night reads this thank you for the best hospitality I have had in years.
Very friendly staff. Beautiful place.
I grew up not even a half a mile up the road the place is a great place to take the whole family camping

name: Almost Home RV Park
comments: We stayed the week of Memorial weekend and thoroughly  enjoyed it. The owners are very friendly and put the customer first. We couldn't get the cable to work and even though the owner was bar-b-queing for company and mowing he kept checking to see if it was working. I kept telling him to wait until the next day but he refused to do so. He didn't  give up until he had it working. The park was very quiet and and there's a nice large flea market close to the park. A great place to rest while traveling or to stay for a week or longer. We will definitely stay again.

Clean and convenient place with great people! Needed a quick pull in overnight in an area when 50 amp service was really hard to find. Family owned and this family really cares about their guests! Although we arrived around 8 pm, they met us when we arrived and helped us get in and parked before dark!  Will stay here again!

Nice cozy RV Park.  Plenty of privacy, they have an on-site laundry, showers and are currently installing a playground for little ones.  Public grilling area, as well as grilling at private sites (grill at private sites not provided) .  The owners are very courteous and professional.  Definitely a revisit in our future travels.
The nicest people. Very helpful with places to visit in the area. They really made it feel like home.
Park owner was very accommodating.  Worked late to make sure the cable TV was working correctly.  Assisted with hook-up.

name: Aspen Family Campground
location: 217 Tuttle Hill Rd, Candor, NY 13743, USA
comments: Loved our tent camping weekend here. Pool was a bit chilly but we enjoyed it nonetheless. Owners are extremely nice and friendly, we will be back the next time we are in the area. Thank you Aspen Family Campground for a peaceful, relaxing getaway weekend.
Wish the weather wasn't getting colder soon , seasonal site are the best thing for me but it is so beautiful here that is why I chose here

Very nice place and very friendly owners. We were exploring the Finger lakes and Ithaca region and stayed for a few nights. We had a quiet spot in the woods, and enjoyed campfire and swimming in their private lake.

Loved the place for the price. We found this place cheap compared to other camps. Definitely recommended for those looking for good price with basic amenities. Hosts are pretty good and they will help you in all the ways possible to make our stay good. It's close to Ithaca and buttermilk water falls n tens of miles from Watkins. Worth a try. N most importantly they won't complain you for late night parties unless you are too loud.
I'm in love with all this place

name: Davidson's Countryside Campground
comments: Very peaceful here. My girlfriend and here family have been coming here for over 12 yrs now. They invited me 5 yrs ago and i have been coming ever since. It's a nice place to come and get away from all the every day craziness.
Great place to go camping with the family! Luckily there is electricity and water so hooking up to the site is easy! Lots of fun at Davidson's.

Davidson's campground is a great place to camp. The campground is family oriented, the facilities are well kept and the staff is friendly. They have a pool as well as the campground is situated on the Pemi river. They have kayak & canoe rentals, a beach area and a boat launch. There are many  things in the area for activities as well as just sitting in front of a fire and relaxing with friends or a good book.
Friendly staff, clean campground, nice ambient with lots of choices between wooded sites and open areas. The river is a plus with water activities.
Been coming up here to camp for a few years now, even had my wedding ceremony in the field. Folks who own the grounds are good people, staff are always nice.

name: Spring River Camp & Canoe
comments: Wonderful from beginning to end. The staff was very accommodating and patient. I hadn't canoed in 30 years and our driver did a great job of preparing us for the trip ahead. They provided the boats, paddles, life jackets, and a bungee cord to keep our cooler in place. They got us out safely and was right on time for pick-up.  Be advised that the Spring is really not for a novice but it's great for laughs. Enjoy!
They pray with you befor you go on the river.
Very nice people. Very good prices. Will definitely float with them again.
Just Beautiful

name: Crawford Notch Campground
location: 1138 US Route 302, Hart's Location, NH 03812, USA
comments:
Went to Crawford Notch Campground two weeks ago with my two cousins from Rhode Island. We had a very good campsite with a great view of the river. My cousins have been there many times and this was my first time there. We met the new owner (John, who grew up in Lynbrook and moved to NH many years ago) he was very nice and accommodating to our needs.  The Bathrooms were surprisingly clean and well kept. The showers were clean and had plenty of room for showering as well as changing. Plenty of HOT WATER!  Coin operated which I liked because people would not be taken showers for and hour while you waited. We had no wait time. They do have security to keep the campers safe from any wild life. Remember you are out in the woods of NH. The gentlemen at the front desk could have been  a little more
 personable when we arrived. "No big deal and not a game changer" Great Location and if your into camping and going to NH give Crawford Notch Camp Ground a try. I don't think you will be disappointed and when you see the owner  John walking his dog don't forget to say Hi and give him a wave. You'll be glad you did. Just tell him Bruce from Long Island sent you..  Happy Camping At Crawford Notch.

There was a mix up in the beginning about our dogs but it was quickly resolved and they worked with us. Our site was clean, private, and quiet. It is really nice here and every worker we met was also just as nice. There are walking trails around the campground going into 60 acres of woods which is awesome. I saw a few reviews on here about a creepy security guard and a golf cart driving around "spying" all day which was not the case. There was nobody "creepy" or jumping from out of the woods. The golf cart went by twice during quiet hours, which is understandable and appreciated to make sure people aren't being inconsiderate of the rules or campers. The only negative I have, which isn't the campgrounds fault is some people did not leash their dogs. We leash our dogs 100% of the time and it is the rule at this campground and we were told when we arrived to make sure they are leashed all the time (it also respects other people with dogs). It was discouraging to see some dogs unleashed but again, not the campgrounds fault. I know if they saw it they would have said something. Other than that, we had a great time and we plan to stay here again in the future.  We stayed at site 93 and it was really nice.

Awesome place.  Quiet.  River view.  Clean.  Staff is courteous, inviting and helpful.  
Cabin was clean n cozy.

This is a REAL campground!  Super clean and very wooded with privacy and amazing views of the mountains! Some other reviews mentioned dumpsters being close to cabins, which isn't the case at all, and the cabins are close to the bath houses which is super convenient. The bathouse is modern and cleaned daily. The general store is extremely well equipped- food, beer, wine, camping gear, hiking gear, ice, camp wood, breakfast sandwiches every morning, coffee, souvenirs.... And the prices are completely reasonable- it's the only store within 25-30 miles! Allows dogs unlike any other campground in the area because they are all national Forest campgrounds. Definitely one to check out!

This was our second time staying at the campground.  The sites are very secluded and our site was on the river.  It was beautiful and very enjoyable.  The staff is not overly friendly by any means which is disappointing as many other people in the area are super friendly.  The showers were hot, but the cleanliness of the bathrooms were disappointing.  Our site was close to the bathhouse, which I highly recommend if you're going with little ones.  I felt that the bathhouse was very neglected by staff (except for the 12-2 cleaning).  Everyday that we went to the bathroom one of the stalls had no toilet paper...how does that happen if you are keeping your bathhouse clean?  The bathhouse was always soaking wet, which I would understand because of the showers, but all it would take would be an hourly visit by the staffers to squeegee the floors.  The counters were always soaked too, but again, the staffers could do an hourly visit to wipe things down for their guests...especially for the prices that are being paid.  We thought the security was great and we felt very secure staying there.  I do think the 11:30pm and your campfire must be out was a little crazy, but the quiet hours were awesome for camping with little ones.  If you're camping to party, then this is not the campground for you, but if you're camping with little ones, then I would recommend this place.  We thought about returning to this campground with my parents and they stay in a cabin, but after reading how stinky the cabins are due to the dumpsters, we probably won't do that now.  The dumpsters are VERY stinky and they are right next to the cabins.  The camp store is pricey, but I've never seen one that isn't overpriced...just buy your goods in town.

name: Lafayette Place Campground
location: 2 Franconia Notch State Park, Franconia, NH 03580, USA
comments: Best campground we've stayed at. The bathrooms and showers are kept very clean as is the entire campground. There is a dishwashing station provided right outside the shower facility with two sinks, hot and cold running water and an overhang. We found this to be quite the luxury. No trash laying about and the campsites are very well maintained, flat and spacious. The staff is very friendly and works very hard to maintain the campground. They are present but not intrusive and very responsive to issues and concerns. Highway noise is apparent from all areas of the campground. This is unfortunate, but something we got used to. And the trade off for being in a really prime location near all of the great attractions around Franconia Notch is well worth it. There are some really great trails that leave right from the campground. We did the Lonesome Lake trail which was quite a workout but totally worth it as the lake is just stunning. Big props to the staff who maintain and operate this park and the NH State Parks for running this place properly. We'll be back again for sure.

Great place to access hiking trails, staff friendly and helpful, restrooms and showers clean.  The sites and roads are a little tight for a travel trailer but doable.  Also there is no dump station so you have to go up the street and pay $25. The only real drawback is the road noise from I-93.  I thought it would become white background noise but it was loud, it seems to echo off the mountains. I won't go back because of it.

The campground and facilties are pretty and well kept, but the proximity to Rt. 93 made it feel like we were sleeping under a freeway overpass.  You cannot hear the leaves rustling, birds or crickets chirping over the horrendous noise of the air brakes from the tractor trailers that pass all night long. Sadly, one of the worst camping experiences I've ever had.

We stayed here August 7-8, 2017. It was really busy! I didn't realize the area was such a tourist destination. My husband and I enjoyed the bike path and the fact that we could get to it from the campground and didn't have to travel to another trail head (although you can start from other locations). It rained which made for a difficult night of sleep in a tent and our site was on a bit of a slope (site 14) and there wasn't a ton of privacy. Since we only stayed one night we didn't use showers or anything so I can't review those but the bathrooms were clean and we had a water spicket nearby which is always nice. We would probably stay here again and explore a bit more of the actual campground. We would just choose a different site.
Very well maintained small camp ground. Friendly hosts. Clean showers, clean rest rooms and access to hiking trails are available right from the camp ground.

name: Rafter D Ranch
location: 7850 N Central Ave, Mt Pleasant, AR 72561, USA

name: Stony Mountain Family Campground
comments: Too exspensive
Great place to go to camping
Enjoy this Campground lots of fun nice people

name: Dam Site Campground
comments:
Overall this is a very nice place to stay in a rig or tent. If tenting I'd stay in loop S all the way at the end of the road, closest to the dam. These spots are right on the water and are shaded. We paid $20 a night for a 50 amp site. We did have some strange electric issues throughout our stay (lost power twice and had brown outs) but overall it was fine. 
We stayed in a 35' RV and discovered finding a levelish spot tricky (in October the sites are first come first serve). We have slides so we wanted views and all our tires on the ground when using the jacks. We ended up in J1 and were pretty level. We tried a few other spots that didn't work. A word of warning, some the the loops are a little tight and curvy and could be unpassable with some rigs. So you may want to wander through or use your tow vehicle to scout out your site. Also, J loop and several others are electric only. A couple loops have electric and water but those were more like a traditional RV park and the rigs were close together. All areas of the park have quite a bit of shade and the park is really nice to walk through. There are many spots with a view of the water. On the way in we used the dump station to empty and fill and all was well there. 
The beach is really a very steep paved hill to the water where some sand is scattered. It's a bit weird but the water was warm enough to play in the first couple days we were here (October 2017). In the camping area there is a dock to launch boats.

Nothing but a up all night animal party house where regular campers couldn't even sleep at night with kids forced to stay up all night from all the partying and yelling all might long and not paroled enough. It's a big joke and all they cared about was the camping fee and making money but a BIG THANKS TO CLEBURNE COUNTY SHERIFF DEPT FOR PROMPT RESPONSE AND THE PROBLEMS THEY DID SOLVE! ABSOLUTE WORST CAMPING EXPERIENCE WE HAVE EVER HAD!!! But the campground was well kept and neat. The people partying and how little the management seemed to care is what was horrible. Never go there again. It's a national park where alcohol isn't even allowed. There was no since in that. Crappy management with very little consideration for       regular family oriented camping.
Great memories are made here!!!

name: Pine Cradle Lake Family Campground
comments: This is great camp ground that is perfect for getting away from everyday life and just relaxing. They always have plenty of activities going on so you won't get bored. They even have a cute little store that sells anything you might have forgotten to pack.

First time camping here and definitely won't be our last! Super impressed with the staff,amenities and how well maintained the grounds/facilities are kept. Traveled here from N.Y. and we are avid campers... of all the camp resorts we've been to,this is by far the BEST one so far. Laundry facilities on site are clean and have hot water (a big plus). Bathrooms are immaculate and have great water pressure in showers (which are pristine). The camp store has all you need and then some... (Hershey ice cream stand) oh yeah! Kayacks,4 person pontoon like boats to rent,a splash pad for the little ones and a beautiful sparkling clean pool. This truly is a piece of heaven! Can't wait to book again next year (only we will stay longer)!
Fun place to bring your family lots of things to do campground is beautiful.
Honestly one of the best weekends camping with the family we've had. Noone wanted to leave. Such a nice peaceful and fun place.

What a wonderful place. The view, the cabins, the people...everything was beautiful. I think the pool could be bigger, and the office should be open later than 6pm because sometimes you need something emergency...also wifi should be free. Is bad enough for you to have to pay for it. That's why I give 4 stars instead of 5.
Loved this place.

name: Ben's Campground
comments: The nicest camp grounds I have been to in a long time
Very beautiful state park clean & nice staff!!
Great all around camping spot! My fav!
Terry handled the camping needs. Rate was good. Weather was good.
Well kept with sewers and full hookups

name: Montrose Campground
location: 403 Pratt Rd, New Milford, PA 18834, USA
comments: Our first time camping here with our 'new to us' camper and we had hot water issues. The owner was very helpful and came by to help diagnose the problem. He explained what we were doing wrong and we had hot water in no time! The second time camping here with another 'new to us' camper and we turned on our kitchen faucet to find the sprayer  had cracked from improper winterizing. The owner came to our rescue AGAIN with a used sprayer and even installed it for us! The sites are HUGE and each have a nice picnic table and fire ring. The campground is kid-friendly and has a great playground, pool, and even mini-golf. A nice nature trail takes you to a quiet pond for fishing. The store is stocked with necessities and they have plenty of camper specific items as well. This was a very nice, quiet campground off the beaten path but very close to a town that can provide everything that you might possibly forget to take with you. We will definitely be going here again!

We had started to stay for 3 nights we ended up staying for an entire week place is amazing family friendly very accommodating lots of things to do for young children and adults and teenagers for that matter just outside of town only takes about 10 minutes to get to a store plus they have a camp store there that is equipped with pretty much everything that you may need they have a pool a playground a game room hot showers laundry facility a pond for fishing lots of events planned on the weekends
Very quite and relaxing. I watched the moon raise to it's fullest two nights in a row
Love this campground! Very family and kid oriented. Nice location and close to town.

This map marker will get you there just fine, but the mailing & street address is actually 403 Pratt, not 304. I've submitted a request for Google to fix this.

Great campground, been here a week and love it. Full hookups, decent rates, $0.15 per kwh electric (Oct 2016), Coin laundry on site. Propane filling on site. Campground store has some food and lots of RV parts. Owner does RV technician & camper repair, can order any parts you need and have it in 1-3 days. Fun stuff for kids (playground, arcade, mini golf, holiday activities). Owners are very active around the campground and great people, will help you get setup and find you anything you need.

He ido en 2 veranos, no le pongo 5 estrellas porque el wifi y el sauna nunca han funcionado.
Buen lugar. Con piscina e ideal para los niños.. punto intermedio para subir al volcán o bajar a Pucon

Buen lugar, muy cerca del lago Calafquén, limpio, dueños muy amables. Totalmente recomendable. La playa que tiene en frente no se satura de gente.

El lugar es bueno limpio y seguro... Pero tuvimos una muy mala experiencia con respecto al dueño, habia toque de queda a partir de las 12 de la noche no queria que volaran ni los zancudos y para ir al baño tenia que  ser en puntillas, realmente era estresante mas cuando uno anda con niños, al quinto dia decidimos cambiarnos a otro camping ya que en este parecia campaña militar más que familiar. 
Esa fue mi experiencia personal y hago el comentario con muchísimo respeto.
Buen lugar para acampar

comments: La sede del centro no es para nada lo que esperábamos, si bien sus dueños son un amor, eran las 3 am y aun habia ruido y a las 8 am estaban desarmando carpas, algo que deben mejorar con urgencia para la gente que va descansar lo demás muy bien  duchas con agua caliente, cocina con gas, mesas etc.. Seguro por lo demás !:)

Me encantó el camping que está a una cuadra del lago. Si bien es pequeño, para mí fue súper cómodo. Tiene duchas calientes y no te limitan su uso como en otros campings que te dan 5 minutos y máximo dos duchas al día. Hay acceso al uso del refrigerador para dejar aguas, comida, etc. Tienes una cocina compartida con utensilios y mesa, para comprar en el súper Eltit que está al lado y te ahorras mucho en comidas. El valor 5 mil por persona lo encontré excelente. La señora que cuida es muy amable y mi experiencia ahí fue súper buena. Sé que el mismo dueño tiene otra sede con estacionamiento más grande, pero para estar unos días muy bien.

Este camping tiene varias sedes, la que está al lado dela costanera es enana, estás a dos centímetros de la otra carpa. Pero la otra sede, que es un colegio, es recomendada a full, tiene de todas las comodidades que un camping puede desear, incluso te van a buscar en su propia camioneta donde estés y te llevan al camping y todo por 5 mil pesos por persona.
El camping genial a pasos de la playa comodidad total

name: Camping Las Rosas, Pucon
location: Pje. Las Rosas, Pucon, Pucón, IX Región, Chile
comments:
Muy económico ($5000 p/p), sitios grandes con amplio espacio para carpa y mesón. Es más bien familiar, no bullicioso. Algunas cosas débiles, los baños y duchas son los mismos desde hace años, solo tiene agua caliente en la mañana y en la tarde noche. En algunos sitios no tiene poste con luz y enchufe, pero puedes sacar luz con alargador de otros. A unos 5 minutos caminando al centro. Buena conectividad, está atrás del Líder. Ojalá mejoraran un poco los baños y los mesones. De todas maneras una buena experiencia, volvería.
.

comments:
Great camping ground and very close to town and two inland beaches. Got all the facilities you need and every site comes with a BBQ and a picnic table (like most in Chile we're finding) - Hot showers and electricity too.
Some of the sites are in earshot of the main road so not the quietest place if you're looking for tranquility but it didn't bother us. It's got a lovely little river running through the camp and little single sites by it for more secluded camping. Some of the sites are really big compared to other places and the ground in good for tents. It's a little pricey (8k CLP each and kids =

Great camping place. Moricio was great at giving us a tour of the facilities, we have a small tent and we're able to find a perfect spot shaded from the summer sun near a small river.

Es un lago tranquilo y de aguas cristalinas no es profundo en su Rivera... Tiene baños muy limpios
Es un lugar para relajar te, naturaleza donde tu mires el lago maravilloso tiene estacionamiento es muy limpio la gente amable solo debes llevar las gana para pasarlo muy bien .....
Nada que decir, lo mas lindo de este mundo....
