location: Via alla Spiaggia, 35, 23900 Lecco LC, Italy
comments:
Beautiful located under big trees. Camping pits as close as ten meters to the lake are available. The shores of the lake are covered with small stones but swimming is not a problem. The camping area gives you a close to nature feeling and there are a lot of places to relax. Drawback:
There are spiders everywhere, the toilettes, the showers and even at the place where you usually do the dishes. I'm not afraid of spiders, but i really felt disgusted by the spiders close to your body while showering. It kind of takes the relaxing part out of it. I would recommend to skip this camping spot if you don't own a tarantula.
Nice location on the lake. The campsite is nice and basic. Bar at reception. Friendly and helpful staff. Take your own toilet paper. Mosquito repellant is a must.

Nice, but expensive campsite. Tents can be placed next to a lake, which is really cool. Toilets aren't really clean, lots of bugs and there's no toiletpaper or handsoap available. Other than that, the owner is really helpful and friendly and there's plenty of shade.

It's a lovely place with quite many places near the lake but has some few drawbacks. Firstly wifi is only near bar, there is no hot shower (0.5 EUR for 5 min), no toilet paper, bathrooms are not cleaned offen (with bugs) and there are no actual spots, so in our case one night we found another tent in our car place. Not much privacy. Mini market is poor as well and there is no restaurant near. Nevertheless the host was nice.

+
friendly stuff
access to the lake
many trees - you feel like you're in a park

- 
old style camping/equipment
extra paid warm water
a lot of mosquitoes

name: Camping los Chozos de Gredos
location: Plaza del Campillo, 0, 05690 Bohoyo, Ávila, Spain
comments: El CAMPAMENTO CAMPING LOS CHOZOS DE GREDOS reabre sus puertas con novedades muy interesantes en la gestión.Perfectamente equipado para alojar huespedes en el interior de los chozos. El nuevo teléfono de atención es el 630 828 860 y el 630 883 829.
Son chozas redondas con los techos de pajas. Es muy bonito y barato.
Una pasada!!!

El año pasado sufrí este camping. NUNCA VOLVERÍA a Los Chozos de Gredos.

Los precios del bar subieron del viernes alñ sábado, los chozps bastante sucios y descuidados así como el estado del suelo para plantar las tiendas, y algunos detalles más que nos hacen tener claro que NO VOLVEMOS NI DE COÑA.

Si realmente cierra es una pena, aunque supongo que es lo que se merece alguien que descuida así un espacio tan bueno y a sus clientes.

Saludos!
Recomendado para acampar

name: Camping Sierra de Francia
location: El Casarito (Carretera Salamanca - La Alberca, Km 73), 37659 Nava de Francia, Salamanca, Spain
comments: Camping tranquilo con muchísima sombra. De él parten dos rutas de senderismo. Alguna instalación requieren mantenimiento. Tiene piscina, cafetería, y un merendero en la entrada. Zona preciosa.

Entrañable. Atención personal y muy buena. Pendientes ddel cliente. Los baños necesitan un poco más de atención. En general una estancia muy agradable, para volver. Recomendable para ir con caravana, con familia. Bien ubicado.

Parcelas amplias y con suficiente intimidad y sombra. Los baños limpios y suficientes. Tiene una senda que sale de la misma puerta del camping accesible y cómoda, en la que se pueden ver ejemplares impresionantes de castaños centenarios. El personal del camping muy amables.
el camping cerrado , pero al menos tuvimos alrededor un buen sitio para comer con sus mesas de piedra . , recomendable .
Baños muy limpios y cuidados, la piscina excelente .Han sido muy amables al atendernos y nos han dejado dos parcelas a precio de una porque nuestra tienda es muy grande.

name: Campofelice SA
comments: Lovely people rooms nothing fancy great location

+ Nice Place
+ Very clean Places
+ Very clean bathrooms, showers ...
+ Sportactions (Stand Up Paddling, swimming, volleyball, table-tennis and so on)
+ Good shops around
+ Good bus-connections to nice places
- Prices are relativly high (but i think fair)
- Normal and free WiFi is very slow
- Some times it could get loud because of planes (little airfield is near)
Very good and clean facilities.  Very good for a tent. Staff were nice but the site has some annoying policies.  Two small tents had to be charged as two plots.  Swimming in the river was great.
Beautiful clean site. Toilets and showers are amazing.
Beautiful. I have never seen such a nice campsite before.

name: Camping Ai Colli Fioriti
location: via Case Sparse, 10, 22023 Castiglione D'intelvi CO, Italy
comments: Great place, well structured, clean and friendly people!!
Excellent amenities.  Very friendly staff. Would recommend.
Nice place, kind receptionist, clean camp.

Bellissimo campeggio montano tranquillo e a dimensioni famiglia, area giochi per bambini campo tennis boccie calcio e pallavolo. Bar e ristorante interno. Alla sera animazione per tutti. Mini club per bambini durante il giorno.
Economico piazzole grandi e con ombra.
Un peu en retrait du lac de Come  tres calme excellent accueil parle français sanitaires tres propres eau chaude a volonté.commerces a 2kms

name: Camping Sierra de Alcubierre
comments: Very friendly and helpful staff. There is a little bar/cafe attached to the camping site that serves an excellent cortado. The place was almost empty at the end of september. The site fits perfectly to the feel of the little village and the surrounding desert-like landscape. Very quiet.
Impossible to stay here with the flys from the cattle farm next door.

SUPER.  Byli jsme tu náhodou sami,  první pocity rozporuplné ale velmi osobní přístup místního barmana- recepčního vše obrátil. Super osobní jednání,  fajn pivo, čisté toalety,   výborná večeře.  Pro nás po dlouhé době milé překvapení!!!! ..... A v baru hrají acdc a led Zeppelin... 
Tohle místo si zamilujete! ....

Yendo de escursion con la moto, paramos a comer en Alcubierrre y dimos con el restaurante del camping
Ensalada parrillada de carne ( buena) bebida y postre 12€. Bien de cantidad y calidad gente muy amable.

El camping a sido actualizado recientemente, ahora dispone de WIFI y las instalaciones estan limpias y reparadas, piscina gratis para los campistas durante los meses de verano, en el restaurante se sirve comida casera muy, muy buena, las carnes son a la parrilla.
Dispone de menu diario por solo 10 € con cafe.
Muy recomendable.
Es el unico restaurante del pueblo que da comidas sin reservar.

name: Camping El Puente
location: Carretera BIERGE, S/N, 22144 Rodellar, Huesca, Spain
comments: Amazing place right next to a rio. There was a shop, a restaurant, and nice facilities.
Quite big / crowded and very hot campsite. Not much of shade, tent spots in dust. Facilities ok - showers, shop, restaurant.
Nice camping, right by a rio. Plenty of hikes nearby. Adequate facilities. Paella at the restaurant is nice!

Fantastic location. Friendly and helpful staff who are always smiling.
The facilities are spot-on.
Highly recommended!!

adorable people, amazing place. always available.
Sometimes shower is quite cold. Yes you have to get out of your confort zone it is good !

name: Camping Smok
comments: Camping has some nice places but if you come too late you will be sandwiched between huge caravans on a big greenfield without shadow. Only cash but expensive (2 persons, small caravan = 99pln). Sanitary seem but mold in shower. Close to street. Make sure you come early enough to get a nice place or go somewhere else.
Nice place, good facilities for campers. (Kitchen, refrigerator, clean showers, shop) The city center is very fare, and after 10 pm. gate is closed for cars. So difficult to visit the city.
Nice place, very friendly staff, clean, good information and equipment. A little bit expensive.
Nice enough camp but too expensive!
Great camping, clean toilets and showers.

name: loarre camping castle, S.L.
comments:
Stumbled across this place whilst en route through the Pyrenees. What a jewel! Valentina is the perfect host. Never mind that the views are to die for, the food is also not to be missed. This place is also unbelievably cheap. No, that is not the right way to describe it, I think the word should be, inexpensive. 
If you read this Val, thank you so much for a fantastic experience xx
Splendid Isolation

Muy bien cuidado mucho verde. Le daría un 5 sino fuese por los perros atados ladrando y por las motos entrenado y saliendo probandolas dentro del camping.
Tienen un frigorífico y un microondas en la zona de lavado. 
Piscina y parcelas donde la luz totalmente horizontales. Muy cerca del castillo y lleno de almendros. Las cabañas tienen muy buena pinta y tienen un antiguo vagón de tren restaurado. 
Supermercado con muchas cosas y necesitan actualizar los huevos de mesa.
Una comida sencilla pero de buena calidad. Entrecot estupendo. Trato fenomenal y parque infantil.
Buena relación calidad precio. Pero el comedor es pequeño, conviene reservar. Muy cómodo para comer después de visitar el Castillo de Loarre. Tienen también terraza y parque infantil.

name: Camping San Jorge
location: Calle Ricardo del Arco, s/n, 22001 Huesca, Spain
comments: Site was ok...not easy to find ...very scruffy but safe. Facilities though we're disgusting showers and toilets dirty and broken...If you haven't got your own don't go...oh and there's no drinking water to fill up a container with you have to buy it
Wonderful big outdoor pool!

Super cichy kamping 10 min spacerem od centrum starego miasta. Czysty, trawiasty, przemiły właściciel. Miejsca ogólnodostępne (stoły), basen tuż za rogiem. Śniadanie można zjeść tuż obok. Gorąco polecam

Rustige camping in de buurt van het centrum van de nog onontdekte stad Huesca. Veel leuke dingen te doen in de omgeving, waarover Oscar (de campingbeheerder) heel veel kan vertellen. Oscar was tijdens ons verblijf erg behulpzaam en je kon zien dat hij plezier heeft in wat hij doet. Aanrader!

Municipal mais bien entretenu . Emplacements plats. Gardien sympathique. Grande piscine agréable. Prix bas. Peu de monde.
Un bon choix de halte  au centre de Huesca

name: Camping Valle de Tena
comments: This camp site is very good compared to others I have visited the staff here are very helpful and are open to questions.This campsite is also child friendly as there are many things for children to occupie themselves with. This campsites also provides electricity and Wi-Fi . I highly recommend this campsite to people who want to have a lovely stay.🏕
Excellent Camping Area with cabins and a restaurant. Dog friendly.
Very nice site, good amenities, plenty of places to visit. Well recommended.
Beautiful setting and very comfortable bungalows
Muy acogedor y bonito. Estuvimos dos adultos y dos niños. Los bungalos muy acogedores y limpios. Muy recomendable.

name: Kemping Prima
comments: It's better to camp in the woods than in this campsite.
We arrived and no one was there to let us in. And there was no hot water! And no showers on site! This looked more like a Camper storage site than a campground.

Potwierdzam poprzednie opinie. Syf, brudne i nieprzyjemnie. Non stop hałas - bardzo blisko droga ekspresowa. A przy tym drogo, zresztą brak cennika, facet cenę rzucił... Nie wiem, może miałem się targować. Jedna osoba + namiocie, na innych kempingach za taki zestaw płaciłem 11-17 zł, a w tym syfie 25 + 10 zl za prysznic! 
NIE POLECAM!
Nie polecam brudno brak miejsca na rozbicie namiotu.
niezadbany teren, brudno, ktos tam naprawial auto nawet..... nie polecam

name: Camping la Banera
comments: Ein gemütlicher Platz zu einem kleinen Preis (2 Personen, 1 Zelt, 1 Motorrad 13,90 Euro Anfang September). Der Besitzer war sehr freundlich und man merkte direkt die gemütliche Atmosphäre. Die Waschräume waren sehr sauber, es gab freies WLan und Sitzgelegenheiten, was für Reisende mit wenig Platz immer ein Highlight ist. Die Stadt ist ca. 1 km entfernt und gut zu Fuß erreichbar.

Es un camping pequeño con muchos árboles.  Está a unos 700 m de la ciudad. Es muy tranquilo y está bien cuidado. Las parcelas son pequeñas pero todas tienen electricidad. También en algunas hay mesas y bancos de madera. Tienen un refugio para los campistas que se puede utilizar en caso de lluvia intensa. Los baños son modernos y limpios. Y sobretodo, los dueños son muy agradables y atentos. Los precios son económicos.

En primer lloc, dir que el càmping és ideal quant a instal.lacions i serveis de wc. Però no recomanaria aquest càmping a persones que van amb gossos. És un càmpibg que va de pet friendly quan en realitat no ho és. 
En segon lloc, l'hospitalitat del matrimoni que regenta el càmping no és l'adequada, sobretot el de la mestressa.
Vam patir un episodi molt desagradable amb ella quan a l'hora de sopar li vam demanar si ens podia cuinar una mica d'arròs per al gos i molt maleducada ens va dir que no comprenia ni com podiem fer.li aquesta pregunta.
Sortosament vam fer.hi només una nit. No repetirem.
Tranquilo, bien comunicado, silencioso, lugar encantador. Vamos mínimo dos veces todos los años. Tiene todo lo necesario, los aseos muy cuidados y las parcelas también. El personal encantador.
Super accueil, coin sanitaires très propres et agréable . Je recommande vivement ce camping calme et charmant au milieu de la campagne .

name: Camping Los Galayos in Guisando
location: Carretera Camping, s/n, Sierra de Gredos, 05417 Guisando, Ávila, Spain
comments:
Although the location of this camping is great, the camping itself is horrible. It felt like they tried to profit out of foreigners by deceiving them. They charged me for my car but had no place to park it inside. Our caravan plot (designated by them) was tiny and could hardly fit our van, and as well we were facing some sort of scrapyard/ workshop. There were other plots but we were told we couldn't park there. The staff were not friendly at all, with the exception of one waiter.  We ordered a bottle of wine at the bar and they decided which bottle, and of course it was the most expensive one. The facilities were being painted so you could go to the toilet and have a guy standing around in both the male and female bathrooms.
There were old refrigerators and pieces of wood lying around the campsite and the whole thing looked like a working site. 
There are no trashcans on the site with the exeption of the ones at the entrance at the bottom of the hill.  Also no chemical bathroom disposal in sight. 
Seems like the campsite was made for people with cabins there and they couldnt care less about campers. 
I have had lots of nice experiences in Spain but this wasn't one of them.
If it wasn't for the beautiful river adjacent to the campsite this would be the worst camp I've ever been to.

Septiembre: Camping vacío. Los baños a la mañana,tarde y noche sucios,...muy sucios. Sin limpiar! Cómo es posible si no hay apenas gente???
Conclusión: No se limpian. Pero sí cobran...

Visitamos el local el restuarante el día 24/09/2017, aunque en el ticket figura el 17/09/207,  raciones muy escasas, sobre todo si las comparas con otros establecimientos, 0,93 por persona por el pan que consisitía en una rodajita de barra por persona, casi cuatro euros por lo que no llegaba a media barra de pan... haciendo méritos para tourist trap, la bajada hacia la poza de agua, llena de colillas y servilletas sin limpiar, no lo recomiendo

El lugar donde se encuentra el camping es increíble. En la montaña rodeado de árboles, con una piscina natural justo debajo.
El camping en si, es muy normalito, pocas parcelas para tienda, bungalows y casas prefabricadas q se ve que son de gente que alquila todo el año.
Nosotros estuvimos en un bungalow familiar, dos habitaciones, cocina baño, sofá, tele...muy bien, pero sinceramente muy desastroso. Nosotros nos adaptamos bien pero he de decir que limpieza e instalaciones dejan mucho q desear.
Solemos  ir en tienda, y quizás no lo veo un camping para ello.
Vuelvo a repetir que el lugar es increíble.
Q solo dormir, no se necesita más.

A mí me ha gustado bastante, incluso he de decir que volveré. La atención buena, muy amables. Las parcelas igual un poco pequeñas o mal distribuidas pero bien, los baños de arriba estaban limpios y bien los de abajo Nose, tiene fuente de agua natural directa de la montaña, fuera del camping a un paso está el charco verde y a falta de piscina...(he de decir que prefiero esto a la piscina!) y lo más importante a tiro de japo de la ruta de los galallos. Más aún se puede iniciar desde el camping, eso sí entre ida y vuelta dos horas más de trayecto. Me ha faltado probar la comida y la parrilla, pero para otra ocasión!

name: Camping nr 232 "Gościniec Jurajski"
comments: Very spacious campsite. Lots of clean toilets and showers. Plenty of hot water in the shower! A huge campsite with plenty of space to pitch, lots of trees so options for sun and shade. Beware of the pine cones! Very good for climbers, opposite the Trafo Base Camp which has a great bar with tasty cheap food and a climbing shop.
Overall good Experience. Superb location for climbers. Toilets ok. Cheap. Will come again.
Not expensive (7€ for 2 people with tent and car).  Quite nice located and clean.

"Witamy w samym sercu zjawiskowej i ujmującej Jury Krakowsko-Częstochowskiej... z dala od wielkomiejskiego zgiełku" taka reklama sugeruje ciszę i spokój. Dodatkowo kompleks "Ostaniec" znajduje się w granicach Rezerwatu Przyrody i wchodzi w skład Obszaru Natura 2000. NIC BARDZIEJ ZŁUDNEGO. W weekend 26-27 sierpnia 2017 r. byłem gościem Campingu Ostaniec. Od późnych godzin wieczornych do 4.30 dnia następnego w tzw. Kominku Plenerowym Hotelu "Ostaniec" trwała impreza urodzinowa pana Rafała. Muzyka Disco Polo i odgłosy tej "zabawy" nie pozwalały zasnąć. Kilkukrotnie interweniowała Policja o czym informował przez mikrofon "dumny" gospodarz. Jednocześnie "zaprosił" pole namiotowe na imprezę. "Napijecie się i najecie za darmo" reklamował rycząc do mikrofonu o godzinie 1-ej w nocy. Po kolejnej interwencji Policji wyryczał "Bawimy się dalej, jebać konsekwencje". A po kolejnej - wykrzyczał "Jebać gości" wszystko to działo się na terenie Hotelu Ostaniec. Muzyka i zabawa trwała niemalże do białego rana. - Obsługi Campingu nie było, a co ciekawe numery telefonów na karcie pobytu są nieaktualne! - Ochrona obiektu - 1 osoba, siedząca przy bramie wjazdowej do Hotelu "Ostaniec" nie podjęła interwencji i nie chciała przyjąć zgłoszenia o zakłócaniu ciszy nocnej, - Recepcja Hotelu "Ostaniec" - nie odbierała telefonu. Kiedy wreszcie podjęła połączenie, uparcie twierdziła, że tej imprezy w ogóle nie ma i ewentualny hałas pochodzi z kończącego się wesela. I, że nie będzie chodziła i sprawdzała czy urodzinowa impreza pana Rafała przypadkiem nie odbywa się nie dalej niż 30 metrów od Ostańca... W niedzielę p. Dyrektor Hotelu "Ostaniec" wyraziła swoje ubolewanie zachowaniem swojego personelu i stwierdziła, że byli przekonani, że impreza urodzinowa p. Rafała zakończyła się zgodnie z umową o 22-ej !!! Czyli w Hotelu "Ostaniec" można zorganizować sobie imprezę kończącą się oficjalnie powiedzmy o 10-ej wieczorem i bawić się dalej z kilkudziesięcioma osobami, korzystając z zasobów tego gościnnego Hotelu - obsługi, mediów, dj-a etc - przez następnych parę godzin za friko!!! Za to daję plus :)

Miejsce darzę dużym sentymentem, bywam od zawsze, dlatego z ubolewaniem napiszę, że schodzi na psy. Recepcja ok, pani miła, aczkolwiek na pytanie, czy w dany weekend będzie np. impreza (a imprezy integracyjne etc są tam bardzo często) nie potrafi powiedzieć zbyt wiele "u nas czasem coś wypada, na tę chwilę nie ma, ale nie wiadomo". Na kartach meldunkowych są nieaktualne numery telefonów "bo mamy stare karty", więc gdyby ktoś chciał w nocy coś zgłosić nie ma szans. Na recepcji jest pani do 23.00. Ktoś wspominał o ciszy nocnej - trudno powiedzieć, że się jej przestrzega. Nikt tego nie pilnuje, raczej ludzie sami się uciszają, bo po 23.00 i tak nikogo na recepcji nie ma.  Bardzo dużym plusem jest kuchnia i obsługa tejże, natomiast sąsiedztwo hotelu Ostaniec dostarcza dodatkowych wrażeń przy okazji imprez plenerowych, które tam się odbywają. Nie polecam korzystania z pola w jego najdalszym fragmencie, bo znajdziemy się w samym centrum czyjegoś jubileuszu. Ostatnio ludzie przenosili się z namiotów do samochodów i odjeżdżali na środek pola namiotowego żeby było choć trochę ciszej. Obsługa hotelu Ostaniec, który jest odpowiedzialny za imprezy, olewa sprawę i zupełnie nie panują nad tym, co się dzieje na ich terenie. Bardzo często w Ostatńcu są również wesela na sali, ale jest ona po drugiej stronie, zwykle słychać coś ale znośnie i to bliżej łazienek. Każdy kto bywa na polu namiotowym liczy się z tym, że ludzie siedzą przy ognisku, gadają, śmieją się, piją piwo ale organizowanie w takim miejscu imprez z DJem, karaoke i głośną muzyką jest chyba przegięciem. Jeśli chcecie się po prostu przespać nie daj boże z dziećmi po wycieczkach czy wspinaniu, proponuję się trzy razy zastanowić.

name: Camping nr 57 Ondraszek
comments: Lovely place. Unfortunately the swimming pool was gone/broken. But there is a beautiful pool nearby!
Nice people
Leirin kyllä laittaa pystyyn mukavalle paikkaa mutta wc/pesu tilat olemattomat
Łazienki wołają o remont i unowocześnienie. Miejsce fajne. Ma potencjał.
Tani nocleg, 35 zł za jedną osobę niestety ogrzewanie dodatkowe aż 10 zł. Pokoje ok, z schowaniem roweru nie ma problemu. Łazienki kiepskie zdecydowanie przydał by się remont i naprawa wentylacji.

name: Strand - Camping
comments: Really small camp. But i really like it! It turned out that it is extraordinary and better that extensive camps. It not for everyone.
Cute camp, nice place on the lakeside, best choice in this location for me.
We stayed in Mustafa's campsite for three nights. Lovely host, clean campsite by a beautiful lake. Highly recommended.
Great camping with great owner.
Nice, little camp for a family tent.

name: Camping de Agüero
location: C/ Afueras, s/n, 22808 Agüero, Huesca, Spain
comments:
We spent one night and left. On 7th June the pool and the restaurant were closed, no warm water, but still we didn't get any discount on the rates. There was even a big dog running around which scared our little kids.
We give 3 stars because there were nice green pitches for tents, great view and nice staff.
Nice place in a lovely village!
Incredible beauty! So much to see and do.
Accueil correct.  Tarif très abordable,seul bémol le manque de sanitaires et l entretien de ces derniers...
Camping pequeño y tranquilo, ideal para conocer la zona

name: Kemping - pole namiotowe "Kotarz" Brenna Centrum
comments: Ok

W porządku właściciel, gdy w piątek po południu przyjechałem to na samym początku powiedział, że w sobotę ma się zepsuć pogoda i jak to się sprawdzi to możemy się zwijać nie ponosząc kosztów za rezerwację do niedzieli. Sytuacja się potwierdziła. W sobotę zapłaciliśmy za jedną dobę. Pole usytuowane w dobrym miejscu - nieopodal rzeki. Blisko obwoźne wesołe miasteczko, mini golf, sklep Biedronka. Cenowo naprawdę tanio. Kibelki i prysznice czyste. Polecam. Kemping dla rodzin z dziećmi i starszych osób. Młodzieży chcącej imprezować odradzam.

Idealny kemping dla rodzin z dziećmi. Czysto i bezpiecznie. Właściciel imprezowiczom powiedzial - nie!, dlatego jest tam spokoj. Sanitariaty sa czyste i zadbane. Prąd dla chetnych dostepny. Niezauwazyłam aneksu kuchennego, ale dla nas to nie problem. Polecam, bylismy tam dwa razy i za kazdym razem było super.

Czysto spokojnie bardzo dobry gospodarz.wszedzie blisko w sąsiedztwie  centrum Brennej rzeka góry las plac zabaw park rozrywki boiska wielofunkcyjne mini golf dla dzieci karuzele restauracje kawiarnie sklepy wszystko blisko

Bardzo fajne i spokojne miejsce. Świetna lokalizacja, miła obsługa. Jedyne czego mogłabym się przyczepić to brak zakazu palenia. Fajnie gdyby właściciel wyznaczył do tego specjalne miejsce z dala od innych. To był jedyny minus palacy "sąsiedzi" i smród papierochów. Mam nadzieję że właściciel jakoś się z tym upora.
Miejsce godne polecenia!!

name: Camping Bolaso
location: Ctra. Gallur - Sangüesa, Km. 46,1, 50600 Ejea de los Caballeros, Zaragoza, Spain
comments: So glad to find this place whilst motorcycle touring recently. I was here to ride the trails in the Bardenas National Park which are fantastic. The owner/manager was very friendly, it was very quiet so I had a choice of places to camp, the toilets and showers were very clean and hot for a good wash after a day in the dirt. WiFi worked and was free. Had a games room which the kids seemed to be enjoying and the location is very peaceful on the fishing lake. Never got to try the local cafe/restaurant as it was closed Friday evening and then had a big event on the next day. Great location for Ejea and exploring the local area. Will use again when I go back. Would give it 5 stars but I am British and don’t do that sort of thing. Maybe a takeaway pizza shop would have nailed it for me.
We were there for a wedding reception. We're vegan and the chef made us wonderful food. We are grateful. El cocinero es estupendo.
Helpful staff especially Richardo
Meets basic requirements

Camping muy acogedor, muy tranquilo, se respetan las horas de descanso. Los lavabos y duchas a pesar de estar de origen están muy limpios, siempre hay papel. Hay jabón y papel para lavarse las manos, un detalle importante. Fichas con agua a presión muy correcta, funcionan perfectamente tanto Agua caliente como fría. Parcelas adecuadas. Sombras correctas y muy buena atención. El restaurante hacen menú por 12e (entre semana) muy correcto.

name: Camping de Candeleda
location: Paraje El Llano, s/n, 05480 Candeleda, Avila, Ávila, Spain
comments: Lugar muy bonito y con buenas comodidades. Espacio amplio. Baños y duchas abundantes e instalaciones limpias. Gente muy amable.

Un lugar fantástico! Perfecto para ir en familia. El personal maravilloso y las instalaciones muy bien. La piscina genial, limpia y con césped bien cuidado. En general procuran que todo este muy bien y al igual que piden que se respete las pocas normas que hay,  te atienden muy bien y con cariño.
Aceptable. Con piscina grande. Presencia de seguridad nocturna pero un poco borde. Los servicios regular.
Camping sin vaciado de aguas grises. Árboles bajos para las autocaravanas, es necesario pedir llave para el vaciado del químico. Lejos del pueblo. Buena piscina. Empleados atentos y simpáticos
Camping tranquilo y familiar. Estupenda piscina con vistas al macizo central de Gredos. Servicios sencillos, pero limpios y cuidados.

name: Armalygal
location: A-132, s/n, 22808 Murillo de Gállego, Huesca, Huesca, Spain
comments:
Very average camp, dry pitches without grass, old amenities, no water in the pool (7th june), expensive bungalows,...but still a great view over the mountains.
We left, better stay in Aguero camp
Beautiful and enchanting

4 dagen bezocht met caravan. Was nog beetje plek in hoogseizoen. Warme maar mooie omgeving. Gelegen naast vrijwel verlaten dorpje maar de hoofdweg ligt op afstand en is sowieso erg rustig. Ruim voldoende sanitair en douche gelegenheid. Prima zwembad en bovendien op circa 300 meter toegang tot lager gelegen snelstromende rivier met stenen strand om echt goed af te koelen. Camping plekken gelegen tussen olijfbomen die voldoende schaduw geven. Vriendelijke receptie. Eten in restaurant redelijk; voor Spaanse begrippen aan de prijs en de kok grijpt te veel in de zoutbus. Wel uitgebreide kaart. Vanwege de warmte wordt pas laat rustig. In de nacht krachtige winden die verkoeling brengen. Zekere spirituele uitstraling op mooi gelegen plekje Pyreneeën. We betaalden 39,65 euro per nacht voor een caravan, stroom, auto en 4 personen. 
Let op: de camping heeft een septic tank voor rioolwater. Je kunt er dus geen chemisch toilet ledigen. Grijs water kan en mag wel via toiletpot.

La comida del restaurante es buena, sin sorpresas. El personal muy atento y agradable. Cómo queja personal, que el solomillo ibérico no era lo esperado. Es obvio que en un menú no vas a encontrar ese género, pero hay que tener mas cuidado con las etiquetas.
Calidad muy buen trato y muy profesional muchas gracias a la dueña

name: Camping El Jabali Blanco
comments: Tranquil i familiar

Pese a tener una buena ubicación en un lugar increíble, resultó ser una experiencia un poco indiferente. El local estaba un tanto desaliñado, el camarero aparecía y desaparecía,  el café cortado un tanto aguado...  En fin, no nos quedamos a comer por la actitud del camarero...

Positivo: Camping tradicional. Familiar y con los servicios que necesitas. Precio muy económico para la zona y adecuados para los servicios que ofrece. Excepcional ubicación para visitar Ordesa. Muy tranquilo y silencioso. Trato excepcional del personal del camping. Dispone de parcelas bien acotadas, mucha zona de sombra, WiFi y piscina.

Negativo: No dispone de tienda-supermercado y la que hay en el pueblo hace literalmente el Agosto (precios desorbitados). Los precios del bar-restaurante del camping son también algo elevados.

En general, si tuviesemos que volver a la zona escogeríamos este camping sin pensarlo. ¡Repetiremos!

Estupendo camping los bungalow, todo super bien cuidado,todo muy limpio y ordenado con una piscina genial, y al lado un chiringuito de pizzas, hamburguesas y tapas estupendo, con una dependienta de 10. 

Recomendable 100x100

Familiar, acogedor y entrañable.
En lugar destacado de la zona.
Marco ideal.

name: La Chapouliere
comments: Great camping with a lot of places in the shades. A lot of accomodation like a restaurant, bar, small shop, pool, playground, football field, and the ardeche.
Good campsite close to the water with lots of facilities

Premier séjour. Magnifique accueil qui nous a réconcilié avec le tourisme en France ! Super équipe d'animation. L'équipe du  bar est  accueillante et serviable. Bonne qualité de produits au restaurant pour un prix abordable. Bon accueil des campeurs vétérans et super ambiance pendant les tournois de boules. Aérodrome à faire fermer dès que possible... Les crêpes de 16 à 18h très appréciées.

Très bon séjour. Très bon séjour. Camping très agréable tout comme le personnel . Sanitaires toujours impeccables.  Le cadre est apaisant et bien entrenu.
Seul bémol, les emplacements un peu petits. Un peu juste pour des grandes tentes familiales
chalet C4. de chalets zijn zeer mooi en hebben een prachtig zicht.Doch smorgens in september soms koud op het terras daar de zon pas na de middag op het terras komt.

name: Bungalow Camping Valle del Jerte
location: Carretera Nacional, KM 110, 10612 Jerte, Cáceres, Spain
comments: Got here late at night 21h00 because of all the wrong info on google maps and we were just told...sorry Closed!!! Not even tried to help us.

Muy buena ubicación, y buen acceso.
Sitio agradable, aunque por la noche el guarda no hace respetar el silencio a partir de las 24h.y los niños siguen corriendo y gritando por todo el camping.
Parcelas grandes y bien delimitadas con mucha sombra, aunque tuvimos dos días de viento y las hojas de los árboles hacían muchísimo ruido, y son  tan altos que temes que se puede romper una rama y caer en la tienda.. 
Los baños limpios, pero las duchas están ya algo viejas, con algunas puertas rotas...
El bar para un pincho está bien, pero para comer es caro,el menú 10 € pero de platos muy escasos.

Hemos estado unos días. Los empleados muy amables. Tienen bar con precios razonables. El camping como punto más interesante tiene todas las tiendas en sombra por la gran cantidad de árboles. Como punto negativo el único que puedo comentar en que el suelo es bastante duro para las piquetas. La verdad que recomendable el sitio.

Mooie camping met zeer vriendelijk personeel. Bijna alleen maar Spanjaarden maar we voelden ons toch zeer welkom. Ruime plaatsen met veel schaduw. Ondanks dat het heel warm was prima uit te houden. Mooi zwembad en leuk terras en lekker koud bier. Helaas matig eten.
Sitio tranquilo en la naturaleza. Las parcelas amplias y baños limpios. La piscina muy bien con verde y sombra. Situación inmejorable si se quiere visitar los pilones de la Garganta del infierno.

name: Camping Aloha Beach
comments: Past it's best. Not 4 star like it's rating says. The toilet block is clean, but no toilet seats. The pool.is jaded and crowded. The pitches are small and crowded. Left with the impression that they don't have to try too hard as there are always crowds in vallon

Super vacances en famille. Accueil agréable, mobilhome en très bon état, les activités proposées sont top, seul les contours de la piscine sont à revoir car quand il n'y a plus de sièges nous a indiqué pas pu mettre nos serviettes par terre car trop d'eau qui stagnait. Sinon, Rien à dire, le petit coin sport et plancha nous on vraiment plu. Bravo à toute l'équipe. Nous reviendrons

Un bon séjour. Un endroit parfait pour les ballades, le canoe, la baignade par contre certaines choses sont à revoir (aucune animation la dernière semaine d'août) et surtout la piscine minuscule et en état de délabrement (carrelage qui part en morceaux, trop de chlore...).
Sinon camping calme nous avons passé une semaine reposante sans bruit et dans un mobilhome assez ancien mais avec tout l'équipement nécessaire.

Très très déçus de ce camping ! Pourquoi me direz vous ? 
On nous vend du rêve sur internet sauf que la réalité en et tout autres ! 
L'accueil laisse vraiment a désiré ! Si tout ne passe pas par eux ( activité extérieur au camping ) on ce prend une réprimande. Les gérant ils sont 2 et il n'y en a qu'un seul qui boss ( Robin ) ! L'autre passe ses journée au bar sans ce soucié du moindre problème.
Les animations sont comme le camping elles ne mérite clairement pas 4 étoiles ! Elles sont organisé a la va vite et ne rapporte pas grand monde. Les soirées c'est la même chose soirée à thèmes très peu de monde. A part la soirée blanche. Mais a cette fameuse soirée blanche on nous promet des bouteilles de champagne qu'on ne verra jamais! La raison ? Pas assez de monde, du coup personnes n'en a bénéficié...
Les mobiles home laisse aussi a désiré des trous caché par le vynile. De l'instabilité quand on marche a l'intérieur. La chaudière et l'eau chaude qui pose soucis..
La piscine ainsi que le bassin pour les enfants en bas âge ne sont pas bien entretenue ( le revêtement du sol )
Pour les nuisances sonores à 22h il faut baissé d'un ton  sinon on vous envoie un vigile peu commode et mal poli ! 
En gros si vous cherchez un camping avec ambiance convivialité et surtout la qualité ce camping n'est clairement pas fait pour vous...

Mitigé. Le camping Aloha plage est bien situé, tout près de l'Ardèche. Mais la plage donnant sur la rivière est en galets et il y a peu de profondeur dans l'eau, hormis à quelques endroits. Le restaurant avec vue sur la rivière et les falaises est superbe, et le service est impeccable.  Plusieurs activités sont à réserver en dehors du camping, je n'en tiens donc pas compte dans cet avis. 
Concernant notre séjour  nous avons été dérangé deux fois de suite par des jeunes alcoolisés, et l'équipe n'intervient pas pour leur dire de faire moins de bruit : il faut se débrouiller !
Les sanitaires ne restent pas allumés la nuit, et il n'y a pas d'interrupteur. Sous la douche il faut se coller au mur pour avoir l'eau, chaude, et qui n'est pas réglable. La piscine est correcte, mais petite.
Bref, un camping qui a ses 4 étoiles pour son nombre de services, mais non pour leur qualité.

name: Camp des Gorges Les Trois Eaux
comments: This campsite is in one of the most beautiful places on earth. It's clean, well-organised and attractive. But it and its neighbouring campsites are tormented every night by mediocre covers bands called things like Pim Pam Pum noisily destroying the hits of  U2, Queen and The Police until 12.30, 1 or 1.30 in the morning. If you're lucky their onanistic drivel will only be echoing insistently down the valley from nearby, as it is right now for the third night running. If you're unlucky it will be blaring at point blank range in your own campsite, as it was the night we arrived here. The nice man at reception told us about the concert when we arrived and said with a sophisticated smirk that it would go on until 6am. "Vous rigolez" I said. Relatively optimistically, it turned out. Listen, just avoid this whole valley until the licensing people in the Département de l'Ardèche and the drunk small-time heavies who travel with the bands have worked this one out. Paradise Wrecked.
Amazing views

Accueil au top! Cadre magnifique avec sa plage et restaurant de camping très sympathique. Un coin à l'écart pour faire ses grillades avec un autre bar très appréciable. 
Le seul bémol, le prix peut être un peu élevé : 25€ pour une nuit en tente deux personnes. 
Dans tous les cas, je recommande vivement cet endroit

Équipe superbe lieu magnifique camping propre calme et chaleureux... pas assez de mots pour définir. J'y vais depuis petite et la qualité de la prestation est toujours au top 
Merci beaucoup
Typische drukke Franse camping aan de Ardeche. Staanplaatsen voor tent zijn zeer matig. Goed restaurant. Jammer van de harde muziek tot 1.00 uur s'nachts.

name: Kemping STYL
comments: Super miejsce
Wiadomo Kemping jak Kemping :)
Bardzo miło, świetny gospodarz, ciekawa osobowość i wzór do naśladowania :)

name: Camping le Peyrolais
comments:
I'd rather gave it one star to keep this great campsite for myself :-) Top location. Great campsite. 
One downside, they don't speak any foreign languages. But you'll manage with hands and feet.

Everything's in order: very spacious, shady places, direct access to swimmable water, a café, and clean sanitary facilities. The only downside is the price: €22 is a bit too much for a camping with basic facilities.
Great site by the river. Friendly, helpful staff.
Nice camping, inexpensive. Very friendly staff, speaks a little English. A bit far from any civilization but it's great for an one-night stay.

Fantastic 
Stayed here in the hot summer of 1990 whilst on canoeing holiday with my school.

name: Camping la Sousta
location: 28 Avenue du Pont du Gard, 30210 Remoulins, France
comments: Cabins are not good, at least the basic ones. Campingplace is in the middle of nowhere with no Restaurant or supermarket nearby. Also Pont du Gard is not visible from the place. At day time you have to pay to see it. Also landscape is not very interrsting and boring. Washing places, showers, toilets for camping seems not to be in a good condition. Poor level of service for that price.

Sanitary Equipment is very old, dirty and needs urgent to be modernizised and exchanged. Furthermore it is not clean! Place is nice for one or two nights for sightseeing. I won't spend more than some days there.
We travelled to many campsites and price / performance level is very bad.
High prices and in this case we expect clean and a good sanitary equipment!

Nice, lively and quite at night....
River is clean and refreshing, different spot where to jump or beach for easy swim. 
Family oriented kids loves it.
Different activities onsite for kids or outside such as "ULM" for sightseeing from above or Kayak (8km) easy from 6 years old etc

This place is a disaster waiting to happen with dead trees and trees with decaying and dead tree branches. It’s also a bit of a maze and if you have anything bigger than a small unit you are liable to end up stuck in a dead end. Eventually managed to get a pitch and hook up only to be told we’d need to move because the couple in a few pitches down had to move to our pitch because a dead branch on their pitch was liable to fall on their unit. When I complained at reception was told they knew nothing about it. A place to be avoided
Great location and friendly staff. Enjoyable stay , enjoyed cool dip in river.and the whole wooded landscape

name: Camping Bungalows Rio Jerte
comments: 3 nights camping in this spectacular spot to take trails. Very clean and washed bathrooms, very nice bar and staff. No noise at night.The worst is the amount of permanent tents and caravans that takes away it natural beauty. Overall Quality/Price very good.
Clean spacious beautiful natural swimming pool friendly hospitable informed staff. Directions on Tom Tom confusing.. Look for the sign on the main road just in/out of town
€17 is not a bad price, compared to rest of Spain. Tent sites are not that nice. They are next to permanent camper vans, and all gravel with no grass.

We really loved this place just by the river. We stayed in a bungalow for 3 days. I would prefer the bungalows faces to the river, but still ours was so nice as well. The small beach by the river were great place to spend afternoon. While we were there, 2 beautiful horses visited to the river to drink water, so fantastic. It was not the peak season, therefore it was quite. It might be too crowded and noisy maybe in summer time, and mosquitoes might be a problem. The region is so peaceful. I strongly recommend you to make the "Ruta de la Garganta" for trekking. There are wonderful waterfalls. The camping place also offers lots of special activities for children. The food in the restaurant was fine.
Fabulous spot with great facilities.

name: Camping Capfun
comments: Great camping with loads of facilities. Swimming pool is overcrowded during holidays. Facilities are separate restaurants and bars. Midget golf. Camping shop, bakery, paintball, laser game, climbing trail in trees,quads etc. Etc. Very large campground. You have to walk a lot for the swimming pool or can go by car ( separate parking ground over there).
Nice place, pool closed  after  holidayseason. Was at offroad camp.
Great slides, friendly nice restaurant at good price. Supermarket was also not a rip off. With in easy drive of ardeche river, but don't follow the sat nav.

Normally, I write feedback on the end of my holiday, but this circumstances call for immediate action. We booked a 'resort' for 6 persons..... On arrival this bungalow was dirty.... OK...we cleaned up a bit, took of dust from chairs and tablets, NO problem, until we saw our shower....discusting......we already went 3 days in a row to the receptioniste and they promised us 3 times in a row there would be immediate action, without result so far.... Also the toilet seat is broken.....
Friendly staff  up in mountain a little difficult access  not really English friendly on the site it self  water slides are great and not massive queue

name: Yelloh! Camping La Plaine
comments:
Clean campsite - not to much ambiance. Clean campsite with nice location by and around the Ardeche river. The swimming pool is very clean though very small and not challenging even for small kids between 2-4 years. The animation only starts as of 5 years and in the evenings children are not welcomed with open arms (there is no kids disco in example) and shows mainly focus on music and dancing .

The French rigidity is felt throughout the campsite making it not very lively and leaving not much room for ambiance.

We will not return to this campsite and have experience with similar campsites for equal pricing where swimming, ambiance and animation  is of a better level.

Short notice family stay. Loved staying here - my little one loved the entertainments and the general area was great.  Pool was lovely (although a bit cold for our daughter) and the staff were very helpful.
Quiet in September, 5 stars ,close 18 sept,lot of animation, games,bar,swimming pool.. ect...ballade velo & canoeing,..

The location by the river is very good - Not sure how cold the pool would be if it was not "heated" we anticipated a heated pool temperature to be more inline with those at Brasilia Canet Plage. Maybe your new pool will be different if built by next year.  The expectation of  people will be that wifi is included in tariffs in the future.

Ein schöner, sauberer und in der Vorsaison auch ruhiger Campingplatz.
Völlig enttäuschend dagegen das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis beim WLAN. Mit 22.00 € für 7 Tage ein Preis am oberen Ende dessen was ich anderen Plätzen erlebt habe. Die WLAN Verbindung würde ich als gerade noch zumutbar bezeichnen. Die Geschwindigkeit von Downloads dagegen gehört in die Postkutschenzeit. Möchte nicht miterleben wie das Netz in der Hauptsaison ständig zusammenbricht. Hier mit der Familie Urlaub zu machen und dabei seinen geschäftlichen Verpflichtungen nachzukommen geht gar nicht.
Dennoch werde ich gerne wiederkommen und Computer und Handys zu Hause lassen.

A nice, clean and in the preseason also quiet campground.
Completely disappointing however the price-performance ratio with the WLAN. With 22.00 € for 7 days a price at the upper end of what I have experienced other places. The wireless connection I would just as reasonable. The speed of downloads, on the other hand, belongs to post-coaching time. Would not like to see how the network in the main season constantly breaks down. Here with the family vacation to make and thereby its business obligations does not go at all.
Nevertheless I will gladly come back and leave computers and mobile phones at home.

Une belle, propre et dans le camping pré-saison et calme.
Totalement décevant contre le rapport prix / performance dans le réseau local sans fil. Avec 22.00 € pour 7 jours, un prix à l'extrémité supérieure de ce que j'ai connu d'autres endroits. La connexion WLAN je qualifierais simplement raisonnable. La vitesse de contraste des téléchargements, appartient au temps de stagecoach. Vous ne voulez pas voir comment le réseau pendant la saison de pointe est constamment en panne. à faire ici avec les vacances en famille tout satisfait pas à tous ses engagements commerciaux.
Néanmoins, je tiens à revenir et les ordinateurs et les téléphones cellulaires à la maison.

name: Campings Sites et Paysages
location: 89 Rue du Petit Bois, 07120 Ruoms, France
comments: This site is a typical French holiday campsite, with evening entertainment during summer. Crowded, like many sites around here, but with all amenities.

Bon séjour dans l'ensemble. Mais bungalow vieillissant : toilette penché, plancher déformé qui craque de partout, eau qui a du mal à s'evacuer. 
Hormis cela, nous avons été satisfait de l'ambiance avec des animateurs très sympathiques. Restauration et piscine qui nous ont bien plu.

Camping très sympathique, proche du centre ville.
Nous étions en tente. Les emplacements sont très grands, mais pas tous adaptés aux tentes (pente, sol dur). Par contre ça doit être parfait pour les caravanes ou camping cars. Nous n'avons pas vu les mobile-homes. Sanitaires convenables sans être dans le grand confort. Ils sont assez peu fréquentés car beaucoup de monde est en mobile-home.
Attention, certains emplacements sont vraiment proches des jeux d'enfants, notamment le «château gonflable» qui fait pas mal de bruit. Mais pour l'essentiel c'est très calme.
L'équipe et les animations sont très bien, même si ça se répète un peu d'une semaine sur l'autre.
Mention spéciale au restaurant qui est vraiment très au-dessus de ce à quoi on pourrait s'attendre dans un camping.

Séjour superbe merci à l'équipe. Très bon séjour, équipe très bien, mobilomme (lumière trop haute cuisine et salle de bain), piscine superbe, laverie pas assez de machine, avons passé 8 jours cela a passé vite, par contre triste d'avoir fait la rencontré d'un petit chat roux de 6 mois aussi docile et de ne pas savoir se qu'il va devenir pourrais éte la mascotte du bureau.

Recht großer Campingplatz mit vielen Mobilhomes. Alles sehr eng aufeinander. Die Betreiber machten auf mich einen eher uninteressierten Eindruck. Nur ein Mitarbeiter vom handwerklichen Personal war sehr hilfsbereit.
War Mitte September in der Cotton Logde. Die Lage direkt über dem Fluss ist wunderschön. Aber direkt gegenüber verläuft eine, zwar wunderschöne Panoramastrasse, die aber durch die Tunnel und Galerien alle PS-Junkies veranlasst, hier trotz Tempolimit mit Vollgas und am liebsten noch hupend durchzufahren.
Ausserdem ist genau gegenüber ein Steinbruch, in welchem am frühen Morgen die lautstarken Arbeiten beginnen.
Auch stehen die Lodges recht nah beieinander, man hört den Nachbarn schnarchen.
Ausstattung ist in Ordnung, Kaffeemaschine, Kühlschrank, Mikrowelle und ausreichend Geschirr. Auf der Terrasse noch ein 2-Flammengasbrenner. Aber der Wasserkanister sollte dringend mal erneuert werden.
Sehr angenehm ist das eigene Bad ein paar Meter von der Lodge entfernt mit Dusche, Waschbecken und WC.
Da der Platz recht groß ist und die Lodges am hintersten Ende sind, hab ich das Restaurant nicht ausprobiert. Preise sind aber für einen Campingplatz recht hoch.
Die Lage ist sehr gut um die Ardeche und die Umgebung zu erkunden.

name: Camping Les Amandiers
comments: Great site for camping, good facilities. Close to train track which I could only hear in the morning. Would stay again

Séjour très agréable. Très bon séjour et bon accueil. Les emplacements offrent une intimité sans pour autant isoler (sinon on ne choisit pas un camping).
L'espace aquatique était très sympa, le grand bassin était un peu petit malgré tout.
Un petit bémol sur le non respect des consignes dans la piscine. On aurait aimé à ces moments une surveillance pour que certains comportements ne nuisent pas  aux autres.
Dans l'ensemble, je recommande, ainsi que mes enfants qui se sont bien amusés, ce camping.

Camping très médiocre, ne mérite en aucun cas les 4 étoiles. À l'arrivée nous avons attendu 1h30 en plein soleil a 40°c. L'accueil a était expéditif car les 2 personnes on était submergé. Mobilhomme passable, propreté et entretient a revoir. Les uns sur les autres aucune intimité. Matériel en mauvais états. Aucune activité correct pour les enfants, n'en parlons même pas pour les adultes. Les soirées très mal organisées Et aucune ambiance. Piscine très petite par rapport à la possibilité d accueil du camping. Personnel inexistant. Organisation 0. Rien de convivial pour un camping dit "familiale". Nous ne le conseillons pas et nous ne reviendrons pas.

Camping calme,. Bonne situation pour visiter les alentours.
Dommage que la terrasse soit décalée par rapport  à la porte du mobilhome ! 2 escaliers  dangereux !!!!
Emplacement pour voiture pas suffisant.
Wat een tegenvaller!!! Erg vies..geef er niet meer dan 1 ☆ voor..morgen contact opnemen met ANWB hoe zij dit durven te beoordelen met vier+ ☆

name: Kemping OLZA
comments: Kamping wygląda na opuszczony ale można tam przenocować. Jest właściciel i obsługa. Przyzwoite toalety z ciepłą wodą i lokalizacja całego obiektu blisko śródmieścia Cieszyna sprawiają, że jest to dobre miejsce na krótki pobyt.
Niezwykłe miejsce widokowe. Płynąca na granicy Polski i Czech Olza tworzy niesamowity klimat do spacerów pieszych i przejażdżek rowerowych.
Na 2. 3 noclegi 🆗
Tylko dla kajakrzy
Fajny camping

name: Kemping Nad Zaporą
comments: Nie mam zdania.
Fajna miejscówka na odpoczynek po powrocie ze szlaku.
Idealne miejsce na odpoczynek po wycieczce górskiej.

name: EBC Camp Site
comments: Greatest

name: Leonia Holistic Destination
location: Bommaraspet, Shameerpet,Ranga Reddy District, Shamirpet, Hyderabad, Telangana 500078, India
comments: Leonia is a nice resort not far from Hyderabad city, good for a relaxing corporate or family retreat. Food quality was just ok, and variety was quite less. We opted for a day package as a corporate outing. Highlight was the big pool and couple of water slides which were quite enjoyable. Overall experience satisfactory, although nothing special.
Place is good for family outing. Worth for spending whole day here. Changing room should be more clean and proper water.
Flo rider isn't working when visited today. They said it's off since past 2 months. Pool is good with live DJ playing Bollywood mixes... You can get swimming costumes to buy...
Great Place For Outing. Very happy with Your Service.

Nice place for family outing.
Swimming pool with DJ playing Bollywood songs is really a good experience.

name: Haldia Fair Ground
comments: Enjoy this fair,,and waiting..

말이 필요없는 곳
샬롬 빌리지 2박3일  휠링왔어요

최고

계곡있고 시원한 그늘도 있는캠핑장 샤워장과온수 좋고요. 아이들 20시에 영화도 틀어주시네요.
여름 강추. 정말 시원한 곳
시원하고 맛있음
서비스 보통

name: 구만동쉼터야영장
location: 1102-2 Yongdae-ri, Buk-myeon, Inje, Gangwon-do, South Korea
comments:
아들이.캐핑장.가보자고해서.추석연휴를
보내면서.리조트에서3박4일을보내고
구만동캠핑장에온가족이갔더니
시설도.잘되어있고노인들이.지내기도온수로.샤워시설도.잘되어있고.공기는.말할것도없이
상쾌하고.자고일어나면 .몸도마음도 가볍고

정말 쉬기 좋은곳입니다.

오늘 비온대서 어제오후에 취소하려는데 페널티가 어떻게 되냐고 했더니 전액환불해준답니다.

 역시나 오길 잘했습니다.
계곡물 깨끗하고 공기도 좋고 적극 추천합니다.

얕은 수심이라 애들 놀기에 딱 좋았습니다.
그리고 키즈방방도 있어서 물놀이를 하지 않을때도 아이들이 놀거리가 있어서 더 좋았습니다.
무엇보다 샤워장과 화장실을 수시로 치우시는지 거의 항상 깨끗하게 유지가 되는 점이 인상적이었습니다.

한달에 2~3번 정도 갑니다 
공기 좋고 산새 소리가 정말 좋은 곳이죠

comments: Cabins are in a good setting. The reception here is very nice.

Nice Place Good View Best Service

Hern Tai Resort, a fantastic place you should be here. The room is cozy and clean with very beautiful nature view. Cost is reasonable. Also, free bicycles are provided for you to look around the local people culture in Mae La Noi.
Great place to sleep the night. Clean and good service. Beautiful view

name: Fuang Fah Camping
location: 51 moo 10, Tambon / Chang Khoeng, Amphoe / Mae Chaem, Chiang Mai 50270, Thailand
comments:
Inscredible place to spend a warm summer night! 
Hosts speek fluently English, French and Portuguese, which makes staying much more enjoyable for long conversations!
The photos are not as good as the real view, which is much better! Keep following Google maps, even when it seems you are too much off-road!
The place has a restaurant and food is home cooked, just delicious! For sure I will return, since it is the perfect place to stay on the mid way up to the summit!

What a cracking place! We rocked up at 6pm with no booking and were welcomed with open arms by Laurent and his wife. We spent the whole night having a laugh with them all and enjoying delicious food and drink. Such a beautiful location too! One of the best nights of our holiday, we will be back!! :)
Very friendly host family, amazing view. Located close to mae hong son loop. I arrived really late and became a heartly welcome.

I'm so happy that I choosed this place! ... If you want to stay in a five star hotel you are definitively at the wrong address but if you search for an experience away from the stereotyp "pataya/full moon Thailand" I can greatly recommend this place. In the middle of the nature with the doi inthanon in its back and only a bark of a dog or the scream of an eagl "disturbing" the quietness it is the perfect place to escape the hustle and bustle of Bangkok or other places. Even if the place is amazing the thing which made me to write this comment, are the two more than friendly hosts! From the first second I felt welcomed. Couldn't imagine a better start for my journey ! Hope I can visit you some time in near futur again :) I wish only the best for the two of you !

Unique place, beautifully located with the most friendly and helpful owners.
There are many places to visit that aren't known to tourists yet.

comments: great place. absolutely quiet. feel like0 robinson crusoe.i booked the doorm...so i sleep like under the sky...open room.very easy. good handmade fresh food (thai style). only be careful and remeber that this resort is only reachable by boat. if you take the cheap shared boot could be you wait many hours for transfer to and back. you can charter a boot but its more expensive! 60myr plus...one way and at the pier they trie to ask for more money...but if youre there...its special and i think there are no many places on earth like this...

name: Anawangin Cove
location: Anawangin Cove, Pundaquit, San Antonio, 2206 Zambales, Philippines
comments: A beautiful cove that is slowly being discovered by tourists. No fancy amenities. Great place to go if you want to be one with nature. This cove used to be bare but after the eruption of Mt. Pinatubo, the ashes made the land fertile and 20 years later tall majestic pine trees adorn the serene landscape. A short hike inland would lead you to a beautiful waterfall. No hotels at the cove but anyone is welcome to pitch a tent and camp.

Anawangin Cove is a best place to spend with your friends or loved ones. There is no electricity or signal and it will give you more time to spend with them. Chat, talk, sing and play with them. The beach is clean, specially the end part of the curb on the right when facing the sea. We enjoyed camping and swimming.
Had a great bonding with my friends here. We did lots of fun and activities. Just make sure you bring enough food so you won't starve. Hehe.
I didn't expect this place to be this beautiful. I want to stay here for camping on my next visit. You can even do 10 minutes trekking for a breathtaking view.

Beautiful place. A wonderful experience to camp there overnight and get in touch with your inner girl/boy scout. The night sky is also different from what we see in the city.  It's also a great place to hang out with friends and not have the distraction of electronics. The place can get a bit crowded on holidays and the weekends. But I think that just adds to the fun. The more the merrier, right? However, there is a problem with a lot of people going to Anawangin and that is people tend to throw away rubbish all over the place. The campgrounds literally have trash bins all over the place but people can't be bothered to put their rubbish in the bins. For people planning on visiting Anawangin, please don't litter. It's a beautiful place and we'd like it to stay that way.

comments: Really great services. Totally new service house with showers bathrooms, toilets kitchen washing machine. All free of charge. Very available reception, open to 23. And the restaurant at the site was fantastic. Also easy to find. Prices were very good as well.
A nice place to spend the night! Affordable rates, and great sanitary facilities.

We are member of Acsi en this campground was not in the Acsi book, but what a campground. Wow. When you are visiting Norway you definitely have to stay at this campground. Great facilities. Very friendly employees. Very nice bathrooms/showers. Thank you very much for this wonderfull experience. It was the first time for me that I saw the cabins that you could connect to your caravan. Very nice. Keep up the good work. Wishing you all the best.

Well made traditional dishes, good selection, reasonable prices, clearly labeled for food intolerances.

name: Parky's Wonderland
comments: What a wonderful stay. The management and staff are the nicest friendliest people. The park is super clean and the facilities are fantastic. I would highly recommend this park to anyone looking for a holiday

This was a truly amazing day.  My Granddaughter was a little upset that she was slightly too small for the rope course.  But we were assured she could do it next time. 😁 
*Laser tag was fantastic fun.  It appears best, played with 2 teams (so 4 people in total, but we 3, had 30 minutes of awesome  fun anyway) 
*Mini Golf, that we were told usually takes 40 mins, took 1 hour neat.  That was Great for us, as we were looking to utilize our time, the best way possible!!
*My Granddaughter loved the indoor play room.  And although adults are not supposed to go in it.... We noticed some did... And I think they should be able to, as kids can and will be kids and get ouchies or boo boos.  It did not appear to be clear on the venue, whether adults could go in.  But we were cautioned against it at the office.

My one and only complaint is that although there are vending machines strategically placed around the facilities. (with junk food... chocolates, chips and soft drinks) There didn't appear to be a place to get substantially nourishing food.  Yet you are not allowed to bring in your own food.  That was very disappointing.  (You lose A Star for this..... I'm Happy to give 5 stars, if this is remedied. 😊)  
Still.... I am Delighted to recommend your venue and we will visit again soon.   Thank You
Absolute rip off $24 for 2 small kids and not even a real play centre go somewhere else don't get ripped off here
Great family activities and lots of fun
Fun

Very friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable and clean cottages. Perfect stop if you heading up to the snow.
Great activities for the kids. Very clean and modern facilities. Expect to be busy.

name: 90 Mile Beach Holiday Retreat
comments: Have stayed here many times with family and friends and love it! Highly reccomend
Loved it here. Tranquil. Off the grid feel. Perfect retreat. Thanks to Jan and Ron
Gorgeous place, pet friendly. You can see some farm animals and loads of Kangaroos around. 5 min walking to the stunning beach.

Nice spot but way too expensive! We paid 84$ for a powered side with 4 people sleeping in one vehicle.
Also the owner + service is strange and bad.
Stayed in Driftwood Lodge, very clean and comfortable.  Great hospitality and clean amenities.

name: Seaspray Caravan Park
location: Cnr of Shoreline Drv & Futcher St, Seaspray VIC 3851, Australia
comments:
👍Great facilities in a neat clean and pretty new park... management/park personel really helpful and thoughtful. Plenty of room. Easy access to beach😎. Away from the maddening crowds. 😊 
🤔 Trees need to grow though.... perhaps a little lacking in shade. Also, no local fuel and only eats from the local PO and take away. Reminds me of Philip Island 50 years ago ☺️
Very good facilities. Always very clean. Biggest problem with this park is you are so exposed to the weather because there is no trees. When the wind picks up your in trouble.

Why are you all crammed into parks up the coast. Here you can have it all cool crisp mornings,great fishing, great markets, whales dolphins kangarooYou won't get better facilities anywhere or friendlier managers.
You can keep the northern coasts this is just sensational

Great place. Clean facilities, full kitchen and recreational room for the kids with a tv. All the sites are massive and have power & fresh water taps so you don't have to walk far to fill up a water drum. Really windy as it's a flat open space but can't complain as you are only a short walk from the beach. Staff are really friendly. Will differently come back.

Great facilities and staff.  Busy and noisy during peak periods.  Very windy and fully exposed to the weather.  No fires over summer until easter, so it loses a 'camping feel' for the kids.  Overall, it's a nice place which we prefer outside peak periods.

name: Golden Beach RV Rest STOP area
Spoon Bay Campground
comments: Free campground with toilets; very close to the lake. The area is separated into bays surrounded by trees, so it feels private. The day we arrived a huge swarm of jelly blubber had washed up on the beach. Also had some issues with mosquitoes too - even in June!
Nice and isolated, with facilities. Not busy, beautiful lake. Rare Parkland where hunting Duck and Hog Deer is legal, in season.

A relatively unknown and hard to get to campground. It only had one other camper there on Australia day which I guess is peak season. You could make it into there with a two wheel drive SUV since they have more ground clearance, but I wouldn't try anything smaller, and definitely not with a trailer unless you have something really heavy duty. The ground is all sandy so you risk getting bogged down hopelessly. There's a nice tent spot just before the main camp ground. Very worth it when you get there. you have access to the lake, great views and it's free. Take some bug spray.
